<span style=\"color: blue;\">SCIENTIFIC NAME : &nbsp;AEGLE MARMELOS L CORREA</span> , &nbsp;<span style=\"color: magenta;\"> FAMILY : &nbsp;RUTACEAE</span> , &nbsp;&nbsp;<span style=\"color: purple;\">STONE APPLE TREE</span></b></span> - &nbsp; CAPT AJIT VADAKAYIL<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://1.bp.blogspot.com/-DpZxLSn3H8c/VAFzgW3yVvI/AAAAAAAAvXU/mGW1jCibIDs/s1600/downhbfload.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Bilva tree is called wood\napple tree and its botanical name is Aegle marmelos.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Bilva tree ( Koovalam\nin Malayalam ) has been held sacred for many millennia by Hindus and offerings\nmade to Shiva are incomplete without Bilva leaves.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://1.bp.blogspot.com/-WnEZQ77fk4M/VARMbabe_-I/AAAAAAAAvbE/0Kz4Ze2NNzE/s1600/bilva_ihbcmage.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" src=\"http://1.bp.blogspot.com/-WnEZQ77fk4M/VARMbabe_-I/AAAAAAAAvbE/0Kz4Ze2NNzE/s1600/bilva_ihbcmage.jpg\" height=\"257\" width=\"400\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">As per our puranas ,\nthe bilva or bael tree grew from a spot where the sweat of Goddess Parvati &nbsp;fell on the Mandrachal mountain, which existed\nin the east of mount Meru..<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://3.bp.blogspot.com/-I9ZclNbvwHI/VAF02RMZwmI/AAAAAAAAvYg/a7Pz2o3cSKo/s1600/baHGVDel.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" src=\"http://3.bp.blogspot.com/-I9ZclNbvwHI/VAF02RMZwmI/AAAAAAAAvYg/a7Pz2o3cSKo/s1600/baHGVDel.jpg\" height=\"640\" width=\"640\" /></a></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">People who can see\nauras can see that the bilva tree has a strong aura, probably due to nano\nmercury in its leaves. &nbsp;&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">These leaves have a\nvery pleasant aroma, and water sprinkled on the leaves shine.</span><br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The leaves emit positive energy and absorbs negative energy. &nbsp;Try keeping some fresh bilva leaves at your work place desk , if there is a\nfoul vindictive atmosphere there . &nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span><span style=\"font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Bilva leaves have the\nability to absorb positive scalar energy emitted by the Shiva Lingam.</span><br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The trifoliate leaves (\ntripatra ) represents the three eyes of Lord Shiva OR Shiva\u2019s trishul which\nrepresents the trinity of Dvaita Hindusim &nbsp;\u2013 creator / mediator / destroyer.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Punch into Google\nsearch-<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; line-height: 150%;\"><b><span style=\"color: red; font-size: large;\">DVAITA VEDANTA OF\nSANATANA DHARMA OR HINDUISM VADAKAYIL&nbsp;</span></b> <span style=\"font-size: small;\">.<o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; line-height: 150%;\">The coconut with three\neyes is also offered to Lord Shiva. Only the middle eye can be pierces the the\ntwo are hard.&nbsp; In places where Hindus\nhave NO access to tropical tree coconuts, bilva leaves are used instead.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Goddess Lakshmi , wife\nof Lord Vishnu hold a fruit of Koovalam in her right hand.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The 6000 year old\nAyurveda uses every part of this tree for amazing cures and prevention.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The bilva tree is\nresistant to any harsh condition thrown at it .<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The bilva tree is\nusually found next to Shiva temples. Hindu puranas Shiva Purana, Padma Purana ,\nSkanda Purana, &nbsp;Devi Bhagavatha Purana etc\ndetails the procedures and protocol involving the bilva ( bael ) tree.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Koovalam wood with a\nresinous gum is used as yupam in various sacred yagnas like the athirathram.&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Yupam &nbsp;is NOT a sacrificial post to tether\nsacrificial animals as tom tommed by &nbsp;the\nwhite invader and their fake mutts. &nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://4.bp.blogspot.com/-t5LBKYDLfqc/VAFzmSGqLdI/AAAAAAAAvXc/bP2xBgd_EtY/s1600/eagle-shaped-yaggewgna-kunda.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; line-height: 150%;\">Yupam is a garuda flag &nbsp;pole erected on the midpoint of eastern\nboundary of the yaga vedi of athiratram. &nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; line-height: 150%;\">Spread across 12 days, &nbsp;Athirathram done often in my home town of\nCalicut is the oldest surviving vedic Yajurveda yaga.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">When you have something\nas holy as this for Hindus, the immoral white invader must inject some poison ,\nto drive a wedge between Shaivites and Vaishnavites , &nbsp;right? &nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">QUOTE - Brihaddharma\nPurana says Goddess Lakshmi , the wife of Lord Vishnu prayed to Shiva every day and offered him 10,000 lotus\nbuds. &nbsp;One day she fell short by two buds. &nbsp;Remembering that Vishnu had compared her\nbreasts to lotus buds , she cut one off and offered it humbly. &nbsp;Before she could cut the other boob , Lord Shiva, pleased\nlike pudding with her , stopped her. &nbsp;Her\ncut breast became the fruit of the Bilva tree.- UNQUOTE <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">Bilva\nvriksham prayachchhaami eka bilvam Shivaarpanam.<o:p></o:p></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">Darshanam\nbilva vrikshasya sparshanam paapanaashanam,<o:p></o:p></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">Aghorapaapasamhaaram\neka bilvam shivarpanam.</span><o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Born from </span><span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\"><b>the breasts\nof Goddess Lakshmi ( wife of Lord Vishnu ) </b></span></span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">, the Bilva tree is ever dear to\nMahadeva. &nbsp;So I ask this tree to offer a\nBilva leaf to Lord Shiva. To have darshan of the Bilva tree, and to touch it,\nfrees one from sin. The most terrible karma is destroyed when a Bilva leaf is\noffered to Lord Shiva.--&nbsp;&nbsp; Sri Bilva\nShtakam (v. 6\u20137)<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Goddess Parvati ( wife\nof Lord Shiva ) resides in Her various forms in this tree, Lord Shiva is\nextremely fond of its leaves.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;&nbsp;</span><br />\n<span style=\"color: red; font-family: Times New Roman, serif;\"><i>Below: &nbsp;Sacred Koovalam tree at Guruvayur Temple Kerala ( south nada )&nbsp;</i></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: Times New Roman, serif;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://3.bp.blogspot.com/-z8hR8yXlrXs/VAM0cnXAphI/AAAAAAAAvaE/-54JT8Bx3PE/s1600/GVR%2BVilwa%2BTjrree%2B01.JPG\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" src=\"http://3.bp.blogspot.com/-z8hR8yXlrXs/VAM0cnXAphI/AAAAAAAAvaE/-54JT8Bx3PE/s1600/GVR%2BVilwa%2BTjrree%2B01.JPG\" height=\"240\" width=\"320\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">According to the Skanda Purana, the Bel tree\ngrew from the sweat droplets of Goddess Parvati which fell on the Mandrachal\nmountain. &nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">From then on the Bel tree\nemerged. Hence, it is believed that the Goddess resides in this tree in all Her\nforms. She resides as Girija in the roots of the tree, as Maheshwari in its\ntrunk, as Dakshayani in its branches, Parvati in its leaves, Katyayani in its\nfruit and as Gauri in its flowers.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"color: blue; font-family: Times New Roman, serif; font-size: large;\"><i><b>Below: Goddess Dakshayani&nbsp;</b></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"color: blue; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Dashamoola &nbsp;( group of ten herbs ) -<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Bilva \u2013 Aegle marmelos<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Agnimantha \u2013 Premna\nmucronata<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Shyonaka \u2013 Oroxylum\nindicum<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Patala \u2013 Stereospermum\nsuaveolens<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Gambhari \u2013 Gmelina\narborea<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Brihati \u2013 Solanum\nindicum<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Kantakari \u2013 Solanum\nxanthocarpum<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Gokshura \u2013 Tribulus\nterrestris<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Shalaparni \u2013 Desmodium\ngangeticum<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Prishnaparni \u2013 Uraria\npicta<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">It is widely used in\nthe treatment of inflammatory conditions.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Dashamoola Kashayam\nbenefits: <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">It is used in the\nAyurvedic treatment of pain in flanks, fever, bronchitis, cough with sputum.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Dashamoola Kashayam\ndose: <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The dose is 12 \u2013 24 ml,\nbefore food, at about 6 am and 6pm or as directed by Ayurvedic doctor.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">It is usually advised\nto add equal amount of water to the kashayam.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">It is advised to have a\nlong pepper along with this medicine.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Dashamoola Kashaya Side\nEffects: &nbsp;&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">There are no known side\neffects of this medicine.</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Dashamoolarishta\nbenefits:<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Indigestion, lack of\ntaste, respiratory conditions, fistula, in diseases of Vata imbalance,\nvomiting, anemia, liver diseases, skin diseases, haemorrhoids, urinary tract\nconditions.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">It is used as a general\nhealth tonic.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Dasamoolarishta is also\nused for ladies having problem with conception and pregnancy.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">It improves immunity\nand strength.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>Traditionally, it is\nused in the treatment of following diseases:--</i><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Bilva is called Bael in\nEnglish&nbsp; . Its large fruit is pale yellow\n&nbsp;when ripe. &nbsp;The Hindi appellation is Bel Sripal.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The fruit takes about 10\nmonths to ripen on the tree .&nbsp; The shell\nis so hard it must be cracked with a hammer or a large knife.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://3.bp.blogspot.com/-00PFiWno1IY/VARLPqMy5OI/AAAAAAAAvaw/FADauzJMhFg/s1600/imaggges.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" src=\"http://3.bp.blogspot.com/-00PFiWno1IY/VARLPqMy5OI/AAAAAAAAvaw/FADauzJMhFg/s1600/imaggges.jpg\" height=\"298\" width=\"400\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The fibrous yellow pulp&nbsp; smells good of roses, and it tastes like\nmarmalade . Its&nbsp; hairy seeds are\nencapsulated in a slimy mucilage.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In India we make\nsherbet ( lemonade ) out of the fruit pulp.&nbsp;&nbsp;\n&nbsp;We mix some fresh lime , honey leave\nit to stand for a while and strain it.&nbsp;\nIt is served with ice and a dash of cardamom as an appetiser. &nbsp;One large bael fruit will yield 5 liters of\nsharbet.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://4.bp.blogspot.com/-zAFZMJR64aY/VARKq6cz4nI/AAAAAAAAvaY/k3DE9ZokjS4/s1600/downldeoad.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" src=\"http://4.bp.blogspot.com/-zAFZMJR64aY/VARKq6cz4nI/AAAAAAAAvaY/k3DE9ZokjS4/s1600/downldeoad.jpg\" height=\"266\" width=\"320\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">We also make Murabba (\njam ) \u2013like how we make amla murabba ( gooseberry ). It can be preserved for a\nlong time.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://3.bp.blogspot.com/-3BBpMAhLVdA/VARKwUkN7gI/AAAAAAAAvag/wpTt_pWAChM/s1600/ddd.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" src=\"http://3.bp.blogspot.com/-3BBpMAhLVdA/VARKwUkN7gI/AAAAAAAAvag/wpTt_pWAChM/s1600/ddd.jpg\" height=\"333\" width=\"400\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The pale green leaves\nare aromatic. &nbsp;There are sadhus who\nsustain themselves on Bilva leaves alone.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://2.bp.blogspot.com/-RmdBSZ7mQtg/VARK93j8R3I/AAAAAAAAvao/rON3kR6Vw0U/s1600/5616_bibdlwapatra1.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Every part of the bael\ntree is useful&nbsp; -- the root, bark, leaf,\nflowers and fruit \u2013all &nbsp;have great\nmedicinal value.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://2.bp.blogspot.com/-1Se65-aHtYg/VARLsoi5_zI/AAAAAAAAva8/TS2bhfhDL6c/s1600/Baettyl-Fruit.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The flowering season of\nthe bael tree is during summer season from May to July. &nbsp;&nbsp;The flowers are fragrant, greenish white and\nit contains honey.&nbsp; The bael fruits &nbsp;attain full size in December and ripen from June.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; line-height: 150%;\"><o:p></o:p></span><span style=\"font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">The<span style=\"background-color: yellow;\"> root</span> as well as the\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow;\">bark</span> of Bilva tree is used in the form of a decoction as a remedy for\nmelancholia and palpitation of the heart.</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The<span style=\"background-color: yellow;\"> leaf </span>of Bilva tree\nis useful as a preventive for diabetes. &nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span><span style=\"font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">The fresh juice of the\nleaves is given with the addition of black pepper in cases of jaundice.&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Asthma can be\ncontrolled when a mixture of dry bilva leaf powder and honey is consumed daily. &nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">The bilva leaf juice scavenges\n</span><span style=\"font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">free radicals.</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<span style=\"font-family: Times New Roman, serif; font-size: small;\"><span style=\"line-height: 150%;\"> is laxative\nand unripe fruit is prescribed for diarrhea</span></span><span style=\"font-family: Times New Roman, serif; font-size: small;\"><span style=\"line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;and dysentery.&nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></span><span style=\"font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">People with hypertension\nand </span><span style=\"font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">expectant mothers who have morning\nsickness eat bael fruits. &nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 115%;\">The fruit acts against intestinal worms.&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">The fruit assists red blood\ncell production and helps in releasing energy from carbohydrates. </span><span style=\"font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Because riboflavin is destroyed by exposure to\nlight, fruit juice with riboflavin should not be stored in glass containers\nthat are exposed to light.&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">A fair amount of pectin\nis found in bael fruit. </span><span style=\"font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">sarva papa\nvinirmuktaaha shivalokam avaapnuyaat II 9 II<o:p></o:p></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">II eti bilvashtakam\nsampoorNam II</span></i><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Meaning :<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">1) I offer Bilva Patra\n(A Bilva Patra is so called leaf having three small leaves.) to God Shiva. This\nBilva Patra is a form of the three human qualities. Good Virtue (Satva),\nPassion (Raja quality) and Irascible (Tama quality). This Bilva Patra is like\nthree eyes, Sun, Moon and Fire. It is like three weapons. It is destroyer of\nsins committed in earlier three births. I perform pooja of God Shiva with such\nBilva Patra.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">2) I offer Bilva Patra\nto God Shiva. This Bilva Patra is very pious, soft and there are no holes on\nit. As such it is complete in it self. It is like three branches. I perform\npooja of God Shiva with this Bilva Patra.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">3) I offer Bilva Patra\nto God Shiva. After performing pooja of Nandikeshwar (God Shiva) by offering\ncomplete Bilva Patra (as described in 2 above) to him, we become free from our\nsins.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">4) i) Soma Yadnya\n(Sacrifices and such like things) is performed to receive blessings from God,\nto accomplish good things in our life and to destroy our sins. ii) People who\nperform religious duties even for others offer Shaligram (God in the form of a\nvery pious Stone) to God Shiva. These (i) and (ii) are very pious and good things\nhowever to offer Bilva Patra to God Shiva is much more pious thing of all.\nHence I offer Bilva Patra to God Shiva.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">5) i) Long time back\nKings and rich people in India were donating elephants. ii) Ashwamedha Yadnya\n(Sacrifices and such like things) were performed. iii) At time of marriage,\nfather of bride is donating his daughter to bridegroom, and this is considered\nas a very pious thing performed by him. Above i), ii) and iii) are no doubt\nvery pious things performed however offering Bilva Patra to God Shiva is much\nmore pious thing than all. Hence I offer Bilva Patra to God Shiva.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">6) Bilva Tree is\ncreated By Godess Laxmi who is wife of God Vishnu. God Shiva Likes Bilva Tree\n(Bilva Patra) very much. I perform pooja of God Shiva with Bilva Patra.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">7) When we see Bilva\nTree and touch it, it simply destroys our sins. Even our very bad and biggest\nsins are removed and we become free from our sins. Hence I perform pooja of God\nShiva with Bilva Patra.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">8) Lower part of Bilva\nPatra is God Brahma, Middle part of Bilva Patra is God Vishnu and Upper part is\nGod Shiva himself hence I perform pooja of God Shiva with Bilva Patra.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">9) Whosoever recites\nthis Bilvashtakam by sitting in front of God Shiva temple will become free from\nall his sins and rest in Shiva Loka along with God Shiva after his death.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Thus here completes\nBilvashtakam.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">The lowest limit of\nessential body fat for women is 12% while the lowest limit for men is 3%. &nbsp;&nbsp;Fat &nbsp;is essential for the healthy functioning of\nthe body and women will need to carry more body fat than men. &nbsp;</span><br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The second type of fat\nis \u201cstored\u201d &nbsp;fat.&nbsp; &nbsp;This includes\nthe visceral fat that is surrounding the internal organs of the body (for\nprotection from trauma) and fat that is subcutaneous (stored just beneath the\nskin\u2019s surface).&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;&nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://4.bp.blogspot.com/-MRn6x0szWcg/U_g8QP93aRI/AAAAAAAAu30/Gs7dRo-Fhgw/s1600/SUMnytO-2.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" src=\"http://4.bp.blogspot.com/-MRn6x0szWcg/U_g8QP93aRI/AAAAAAAAu30/Gs7dRo-Fhgw/s1600/SUMnytO-2.jpg\" height=\"640\" width=\"420\" /></a></div>\n<i><span style=\"color: blue;\"><br /></span></i>\n<i><span style=\"color: blue;\">Above: &nbsp;The boy has grabbed subcutaneous fat ( external ) of the Sumo wrestler-- &nbsp;<span style=\"font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Sumo wrestlers\nfrequently have excess subcutaneous fat, </span><span style=\"font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">but little or no visceral fat.</span></span></i><br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;</span><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">&nbsp;.</span></i><br />\n<i><span style=\"color: blue;\"><br /></span></i>\n<i><span style=\"color: blue;\">Below: This pot belly contains visceral fat ( internal ) and this cannot be grabbed by the boy's fingers.</span></i><br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://4.bp.blogspot.com/-54Q4PkXY0K4/U_g8ePfmW5I/AAAAAAAAu38/93TfyihfaM0/s1600/fatbjtvdselly.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" src=\"http://4.bp.blogspot.com/-54Q4PkXY0K4/U_g8ePfmW5I/AAAAAAAAu38/93TfyihfaM0/s1600/fatbjtvdselly.jpg\" height=\"320\" width=\"292\" /></a></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The human body is\ndesigned to store excess fat as an energy reserve.&nbsp; If you consume more calories than\nis needed, the excess calories are stored as subcutaneous fat.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Fat that is located\njust under your skin is subcutaneous. &nbsp;Subcutaneous\nfat can be frustratingly &nbsp;difficult to\nbudge .&nbsp; Belly fat that hangs ( till the\nfloor TEE HEEEE ) and which can be grasped by fingers is subcutaneous. &nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">While the inner fat inside the stomach which\ncannot be held by hand and which makes the stomach stand like a pot is visceral.\nSo belly fat can be both subcutaneous as well as visceral ..<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://2.bp.blogspot.com/-eh-kz79_1IE/U_g-EVuJJsI/AAAAAAAAu4I/mDlQ52FKkTg/s1600/suhgfcdxbfat1.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" src=\"http://2.bp.blogspot.com/-eh-kz79_1IE/U_g-EVuJJsI/AAAAAAAAu4I/mDlQ52FKkTg/s1600/suhgfcdxbfat1.jpg\" height=\"350\" width=\"400\" /></a></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Men tend to accumulate\nfat in the belly women, accumulate it in their thighs and ass\u2014OOPS-- buttocks. &nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n</div>\n<br />\n<i><span style=\"color: blue;\">Below: Cellulite is dimpled .</span></i><br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://4.bp.blogspot.com/-y5jQoPMw6NE/U_g-qMo2_fI/AAAAAAAAu4Q/9xibv7Qwl70/s1600/rr5.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" src=\"http://4.bp.blogspot.com/-y5jQoPMw6NE/U_g-qMo2_fI/AAAAAAAAu4Q/9xibv7Qwl70/s1600/rr5.jpg\" height=\"300\" width=\"400\" /></a></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Cellulite is fat\ndeposits just below the skin, usually &nbsp;in\nthe abdomen , ass\u2014nay\u2014buttocks and thighs .Skin brushing can specifically\ntarget areas of cellulite. In Ayurveda we do nava dhanya abrasive broken grain\nmassage \u2013with each type grain having different hardness and size.&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Using a skin brush in small circular\nmovements over cellulite areas every 4 days will &nbsp;help to break down the fatty deposits that\ncause the dimpled appearance.&nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Usually fat will be\nremoved ( diet / exercise ) in the same order that it was laid down . This\npattern is set by the body and cannot be influenced through specific training,\nas some dumbo sports/ gym coaches think . .&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: large; line-height: 150%;\">Below: &nbsp;<span style=\"color: red;\"><b> DUH ? &nbsp; &nbsp;DUH !!!</b></span></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://4.bp.blogspot.com/-D4gsZwUUwyg/U_hA0unw_8I/AAAAAAAAu4c/zOcPp1o7VrQ/s1600/personal_treeainer.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" src=\"http://4.bp.blogspot.com/-D4gsZwUUwyg/U_hA0unw_8I/AAAAAAAAu4c/zOcPp1o7VrQ/s1600/personal_treeainer.jpg\" height=\"312\" width=\"400\" /></a></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">One of the best fat burning\nexercises is brisk walking. &nbsp;&nbsp;If exercise\nis at a higher intensity, the fuel that is needed to maintain a higher level of\nintensity is pulled from a different source.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Brisk walking is\neffective in reducing excess subcutaneous body fat as you do not feed you face\nmindlessly with junk food at the same time. &nbsp;&nbsp;Plastic surgery such as liposuction of the video\nabove can remove subcutaneous fat but NEVER visceral fat. &nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://4.bp.blogspot.com/-jtWg99IFEqY/VACyFhHDrDI/AAAAAAAAvV8/HDKdJDrD0uo/s1600/00100tty63.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em;
