[6]<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Respect for mother and\nfather is good, generosity to friends, acquaintances, relatives, Brahmans and\nascetics is good; not killing living beings is good; moderation in spending and\nmoderation in saving is good.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Council shall\nnotify the Yuktas about the observance of these instructions in these very\nwords.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">RE IV<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In the past, for many\nhundreds of years, killing or harming living beings and improper behaviour\ntowards relatives, and improper behaviour towards Brahmans and ascetics has\nincreased. [7] But now due to Beloved-of-the-Gods, King Piyadasi\u2019s Dhamma\npractice, the sound of the drum has been replaced by the sound of the Dhamma.\n[8] The sighting of heavenly cars, auspicious elephants, bodies of fire and\nother divine sightings has not happened for many hundreds of years. But now\nbecause Beloved-of-the-Gods, King Piyadasi promotes restraint in the killing\nand harming of living beings, proper behaviour towards relatives, Brahmans and\nascetics, and respect for mother, father and elders, such sightings have\nincreased. [9]<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">These and many other\nkinds of Dhamma practice have been encouraged by Beloved-of-the-Gods, King\nPiyadasi, and he will continue to promote Dhamma practice. And the sons,\ngrandsons and great-grandsons of Beloved-of-the-Gods, King Piyadasi, too will\ncontinue to promote Dhamma practice until the end of time; living by Dhamma and\nvirtue, they will instruct in Dhamma. Truly, this is the highest work, to\ninstruct in Dhamma. But practicing the Dhamma cannot be done by one who is\ndevoid of virtue and therefore its promotion and growth is commendable.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">This edict has been\nwritten so that it may please my successors to devote themselves to promoting\nthese things and not allow them to decline. Beloved-of-the-Gods, King Piyadasi,\nhas had this written twelve years after his coronation.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">RE V<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Beloved-of-the-Gods,\nKing Piyadasi, speaks thus: [10] To do good is difficult. One who does good\nfirst does something hard to do. I have done many good deeds, and, if my sons,\ngrandsons and their descendants up to the end of the world act in like manner,\nthey too will do much good. But whoever amongst them neglects this, they will\ndo evil. Truly, it is easy to do evil. [11]<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In the past there were\nno Dhamma Mahamatras but such officers were appointed by me thirteen years\nafter my coronation. Now they work among all religions for the establishment of\nDhamma, for the promotion of Dhamma, and for the welfare and happiness of all\nwho are devoted to Dhamma. They work among the Greeks, the Kambojas, the\nGandharas, the Rashtrika-pairyanikas and other peoples on the western borders.\n[12] They work among soldiers, chiefs, Brahmans, householders, the poor, the\naged and those devoted to Dhamma\u2014for their welfare and happiness\u2014so that they\nmay be free from harassment. They (Dhamma Mahamatras) work for the proper\ntreatment of prisoners, towards their unfettering, and if the Mahamatras think,\n\u201cThis one has a family to support,\u201d \u201cThat one has been bewitched,\u201d \u201cThis one is\nold,\u201d then they work for the release of such prisoners. They work here, in\noutlying towns, in the women\u2019s quarters belonging to my brothers and sisters,\nand among my other relatives. They are occupied everywhere. These Dhamma\nMahamatras are occupied in my domain among people devoted to Dhamma to\ndetermine who is devoted to Dhamma, who is established in Dhamma, and who is\ngenerous.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">This Dhamma edict has\nbeen written on stone so that it might endure long and that my descendants\nmight act in conformity with it.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">RE VI<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Beloved-of-the-Gods,\nKing Piyadasi, speaks thus: [13] In the past, state business was not transacted\nnor were reports delivered to the king at all hours. But now I have given this\norder, that at any time, whether I am eating, in the women\u2019s quarters, the bed\nchamber, the chariot, the palanquin, in the park or wherever, reporters are to\nbe posted with instructions to report to me the affairs of the people so that I\nmight attend to these affairs wherever I am. And whatever I orally order in\nconnection with donations or proclamations, or when urgent business presses\nitself on the Mahamatras, if disagreement or debate arises in the Council, then\nit must be reported to me immediately. This is what I have ordered. I am never\ncontent with exerting myself or with despatching business. Truly, I consider\nthe welfare of all to be my duty, and the root of this is exertion and the prompt\ndespatch of business. There is no better work than promoting the welfare of all\nthe people and whatever efforts I am making is to repay the debt I owe to all\nbeings to assure their happiness in this life, and attain heaven in the next.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Therefore this Dhamma\nedict has been written to last long and that my sons, grandsons and\ngreat-grandsons might act in conformity with it for the welfare of the world.\nHowever, this is difficult to do without great exertion.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">RE VII<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Beloved-of-the-Gods,\nKing Piyadasi, desires that all religions should reside everywhere, for all of\nthem desire self-control and purity of heart. [14] But people have various\ndesires and various passions, and they may practice all of what they should or\nonly a part of it. But one who receives great gifts yet is lacking in\nself-control, purity of heart, gratitude and firm devotion, such a person is\nmean.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">RE III<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In the past kings used\nto go out on pleasure tours during which there was hunting and other\nentertainment. [15] But ten years after Beloved-of-the-Gods had been coronated,\nhe went on a tour to Sambodhi and thus instituted Dhamma tours. [16] During\nthese tours, the following things took place: visits and gifts to Brahmans and\nascetics, visits and gifts of gold to the aged, visits to people in the\ncountryside, instructing them in Dhamma, and discussing Dhamma with them as is\nsuitable. It is this that delights Beloved-of-the-Gods, King Piyadasi, and is,\nas it were, another type of revenue.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">RE IX<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Beloved-of-the-Gods,\nKing Piyadasi, speaks thus: [17] In times of sickness, for the marriage of sons\nand daughters, at the birth of children, before embarking on a journey, on\nthese and other occasions, people perform various ceremonies. Women in\nparticular perform many vulgar and worthless ceremonies. These types of\nceremonies can be performed by all means, but they bear little fruit. What does\nbear great fruit, however, is the ceremony of the Dhamma. This involves proper\nbehaviour towards servants and employees, respect for teachers, restraint\ntowards living beings, and generosity towards ascetics and Brahmans. These and\nother things constitute the ceremony of the Dhamma. Therefore a father, a son,\na brother, a master, a friend, a companion, and even a neighbour should say:\n\u201cThis is good, this is the ceremony that should be performed until its purpose\nis fulfilled, this I shall do.\u201d [18] Other ceremonies are of doubtful fruit,\nfor they may achieve their purpose, or they may not, and even if they do, it is\nonly in this world. But the ceremony of the Dhamma is timeless. Even if it does\nnot achieve its purpose in this world, it produces great merit in the next,\nwhereas if it does achieve its purpose in this world, one gets great merit both\nhere and there through the ceremony of the Dhamma.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">RE X<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Beloved-of-the-Gods,\nKing Piyadasi, does not consider glory and fame to be of great account unless\nthey are achieved through having my subjects respect Dhamma and practice\nDhamma, both now and in the future. [19] For this alone does\nBeloved-of-the-Gods, King Piyadasi, desire glory and fame. And whatever efforts\nBeloved-of-the-Gods, King Piyadasi, is making, all of that is only for the\nwelfare of the people in the next world, and that they will have little evil.\nAnd being without merit is evil. This is difficult for either a humble person\nor a great person to do except with great effort, and by giving up other\ninterests. In fact, it may be even more difficult for a great person to do.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">RE XI<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Beloved-of-the-Gods,\nKing Piyadasi, speaks thus: [20] There is no gift like the gift of the Dhamma,\n[21] (no acquaintance like) acquaintance with Dhamma, (no distribution like)\ndistribution of Dhamma, and (no kinship like) kinship through Dhamma. And it\nconsists of this: proper behaviour towards servants and employees, respect for\nmother and father, generosity to friends, companions, relations, Brahmans and\nascetics, and not killing living beings. Therefore a father, a son, a brother,\na master, a friend, a companion or a neighbour should say: \u201cThis is good, this\nshould be done.\u201d One benefits in this world and gains great merit in the next\nby giving the gift of the Dhamma.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">RE XII<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Beloved-of-the-Gods,\nKing Piyadasi, honours both ascetics and the householders of all religions, and\nhe honours them with gifts and honours of various kinds. [22] But\nBeloved-of-the-Gods, King Piyadasi, does not value gifts and honours as much as\nhe values this\u2014that there should be growth in the essentials of all religions.\n[23] Growth in essentials can be done in different ways, but all of them have\nas their root restraint in speech, that is, not praising one\u2019s own religion, or\ncondemning the religion of others without good cause. And if there is cause for\ncriticism, it should be done in a mild way. But it is better to honour other\nreligions for this reason. By so doing, one\u2019s own religion benefits, and so do\nother religions, while doing otherwise harms one\u2019s own religion and the\nreligions of others. Whoever praises his own religion, due to excessive\ndevotion, and condemns others with the thought \u201cLet me glorify my own\nreligion,\u201d only harms his own religion. Therefore contact (between religions)\nis good. [24] One should listen to and respect the doctrines professed by\nothers. Beloved-of-the-Gods, King Piyadasi, desires that all should be\nwell-learned in the good doctrines of other religions.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Those who are content\nwith their own religion should be told this: Beloved-of-the-Gods, King\nPiyadasi, does not value gifts and honours as much as he values that there\nshould be growth in the essentials of all religions. And to this end many are\nworking\u2014Dhamma Mahamatras, Mahamatras in charge of the women\u2019s quarters,\nofficers in charge of outlying areas, and other such officers. And the fruit of\nthis is that one\u2019s own religion grows and the Dhamma is illuminated also.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">RE XIII<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Beloved-of-the-Gods,\nKing Piyadasi, conquered the Kalingas eight years after his coronation. [25]\nOne hundred and fifty thousand were deported, one hundred thousand were killed\nand many more died (from other causes). After the Kalingas had been conquered,\nBeloved-of-the-Gods came to feel a strong inclination towards the Dhamma, a\nlove for the Dhamma and for instruction in Dhamma. Now Beloved-of-the-Gods\nfeels deep remorse for having conquered the Kalingas.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Indeed,\nBeloved-of-the-Gods is deeply pained by the killing, dying and deportation that\ntake place when an unconquered country is conquered. But Beloved-of-the-Gods is\npained even more by this\u2014that Brahmans, ascetics, and householders of different\nreligions who live in those countries, and who are respectful to superiors, to\nmother and father, to elders, and who behave properly and have strong loyalty\ntowards friends, acquaintances, companions, relatives, servants and\nemployees\u2014that they are injured, killed or separated from their loved ones.\nEven those who are not affected (by all this) suffer when they see friends,\nacquaintances, companions and relatives affected. These misfortunes befall all\n(as a result of war), and this pains Beloved-of-the-Gods.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">There is no country,\nexcept among the Greeks, where these two groups, Brahmans and ascetics, are not\nfound, and there is no country where people are not devoted to one or another\nreligion. [26] Therefore the killing, death or deportation of a hundredth, or\neven a thousandth part of those who died during the conquest of Kalinga now\npains Beloved-of-the-Gods. Now Beloved-of-the-Gods thinks that even those who\ndo wrong should be forgiven where forgiveness is possible.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Even the forest people,\nwho live in Beloved-of-the-Gods\u2019 domain, are entreated and reasoned with to act\nproperly. They are told that despite his remorse Beloved-of-the-Gods has the\npower to punish them if necessary, so that they should be ashamed of their\nwrong and not be killed. Truly, Beloved-of-the-Gods desires non-injury,\nrestraint and impartiality to all beings, even where wrong has been done.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Now it is conquest by\nDhamma that Beloved-of-the-Gods considers to be the best conquest. [27] And it\n(conquest by Dhamma) has been won here, on the borders, even six hundred\nyojanas away, where the Greek king Antiochos rules, beyond there where the four\nkings named Ptolemy, Antigonos, Magas and Alexander rule, likewise in the south\namong the Colas, the Pandyas, and as far as Tamraparni. [28] Here in the King\u2019s\ndomain among the Greeks, the Kambojas, the Nabhakas, the Nabhapanktis, the\nBhoja-paitryanikas, the Andhras and the Paulindas, everywhere people are\nfollowing Beloved-of-the-Gods\u2019 instructions in Dhamma. Even where\nBeloved-of-the-Gods\u2019 envoys have not been, these people too, having heard of\nthe practice of Dhamma and the ordinances and instructions in Dhamma given by\nBeloved-of-the-Gods, are following it and will continue to do so. This conquest\nhas been won everywhere, and it gives great joy\u2014the joy which only conquest by\nDhamma can give. But even this joy is of little consequence.\nBeloved-of-the-Gods considers the great fruit to be experienced in the next\nworld to be more important.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">I have had this Dhamma\nedict written so that my sons and great-grandsons may not consider making new\nconquests, or that if military conquests are made, that they be done with\nforbearance and light punishment, or better still, that they consider making\nconquest by Dhamma only, for that bears fruit in this world and the next. May\nall their intense devotion be given to this which has a result in this world\nand the next.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">RE XIV<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Beloved-of-the-Gods,\nKing Piyadasi, has had these Dhamma edicts written in brief, in medium length,\nand in extended form. [29] Not all of them occur everywhere, for my domain is\nvast, but much has been written, and I will have still more written. And also\nthere are some subjects here that have been spoken of again and again because\nof their sweetness, and so that the people may act in accordance with them. If\nsome things written are incomplete, this is because of the locality, or in\nconsideration of the object, or due to the fault of the scribe.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Kalinga Rock Edicts<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">SRE I/RE XVI<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Beloved-of-the-Gods\nsays that the Mahamatras of Tosali who are judicial officers in the city are to\nbe told this: [30] I wish to see that everything I consider to be proper is\ncarried out in the right way. And I consider instructing you to be the best way\nof accomplishing this. I have placed you over many thousands of people that you\nmay win the people\u2019s affection.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">All men are my\nchildren. What I desire for my own children, and I desire their welfare and\nhappiness both in this world and the next, that I desire for all men. You do\nnot understand to what extent I desire this, and if some of you do understand,\nyou do not understand the full extent of my desire.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">You must attend to this\nmatter. While being completely law-abiding, some people are imprisoned, treated\nharshly and even killed without cause so that many people suffer. Therefore\nyour aim should be to act with impartiality. It is because of these\nthings\u2014envy, anger, cruelty, hate, indifference, laziness or tiredness\u2014that\nsuch a thing does not happen. Therefore your aim should be: \u201cMay these things\nnot be in me.\u201d And the root of this is non-anger and patience. Those who are\nbored with the administration of justice will not be promoted; (those who are\nnot) will move upwards and be promoted. Whoever among you understands this\nshould say to his colleagues: \u201cSee that you do your duty properly. Such and\nsuch are Beloved-of-the-Gods\u2019 instructions.\u201d Great fruit will result from doing\nyour duty, while failing in it will result in gaining neither heaven nor the\nking\u2019s pleasure. Failure in duty on your part will not please me. But done\nproperly, it will win you heaven and you will be discharging your debts to me.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">This edict is to be listened\nto on Tishya constellation day, between Tishya days, and on other suitable\noccasions, it should be listened to even by a single person. Acting thus, you\nwill be doing your duty.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">This edict has been\nwritten for the following purpose: that the judicial officers of the city may\nstrive to do their duty and that the people under them might not suffer unjust\nimprisonment or harsh treatment. To achieve this, I will send out Mahamatras\nevery five years who are not harsh or cruel, but who are merciful and who can\nascertain if the judicial officers have understood my purpose and are acting\naccording to my instructions. Similarly, from Ujjayini, the prince will send\nsimilar persons with the same purpose without allowing three years to elapse.\nLikewise from Takhashila also. When these Mahamatras go on tours of inspection\neach year, then without neglecting their normal duties, they will ascertain if\njudicial officers are acting according to the king\u2019s instructions.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">SRE II/RE XV<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Beloved-of-the-Gods\nspeaks thus: [31] This royal order is to be addressed to the Mahamatras at\nSamapa. I wish to see that everything I consider to be proper is carried out in\nthe right way. And I consider instructing you to be the best way of\naccomplishing this. All men are my children. What I desire for my own children,\nand I desire their welfare and happiness both in this world and the next, that\nI desire for all men. [32]<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The people of the\nunconquered territories beyond the borders might think: \u201cWhat are the king\u2019s\nintentions towards us?\u201d My only intention is that they live without fear of me,\nthat they may trust me and that I may give them happiness, not sorrow.\nFurthermore, they should understand that the king will forgive those who can be\nforgiven, and that he wishes to encourage them to practice Dhamma so that they\nmay attain happiness in this world and the next. I am telling you this so that\nI may discharge the debts I owe, and that in instructing you, that you may know\nthat my vow and my promise will not be broken. Therefore acting in this way,\nyou should perform your duties and assure them (the people beyond the borders)\nthat: \u201cThe king is like a father. He feels towards us as he feels towards\nhimself. We are to him like his own children.\u201d<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">By instructing you and\ninforming you of my vow and my promise I shall be applying myself in complete\nfullness to achieving this object. You are able indeed to inspire them with\nconfidence and to secure their welfare and happiness in this world and the next,\nand by acting thus, you will attain heaven as well as discharge the debts you\nowe to me. And so that the Mahamatras can devote themselves at all times to\ninspiring the border areas with confidence and encouraging them to practice\nDhamma, this edict has been written here.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">This edict is to be\nlistened to every four months on Tishya constellation day, between Tisya days,\nand on other suitable occasions, it should be listened to even by a single\nperson. Acting thus, you will be doing your duty.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Minor Rock Edicts<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">MRE I<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Beloved-of-the-Gods\nspeaks thus: [33] It is now more than two and a half years since I became a\nlay-disciple, but until now I have not been very zealous. [34] But now that I\nhave visited the Sangha for more than a year, I have become very zealous. Now\nthe people in India who have not associated with the gods do so. This is the\nresult of zeal and it is not just the great who can do this. Even the humble,\nif they are zealous, can attain heaven. And this proclamation has been made\nwith this aim. Let both humble and great be zealous, let even those on the\nborders know and let zeal last long. Then this zeal will increase, it will\ngreatly increase, it will increase up to one-and-a-half times. This message has\nbeen proclaimed two hundred and fifty-six times by the king while on tour.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">MRE II<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Beloved-of-the-Gods\nspeaks thus: [35] Father and mother should be respected and so should elders,\nkindness to living beings should be made strong and the truth should be spoken.\nIn these ways, the Dhamma should be promoted. Likewise, a teacher should be\nhonoured by his pupil and proper manners should be shown towards relations.\nThis is an ancient rule that conduces to long life. Thus should one act.\nWritten by the scribe Chapala.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">MRE III<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Piyadasi, King of\nMagadha, saluting the Sangha and wishing them good health and happiness, speaks\nthus: [36] You know, reverend sirs, how great my faith in the Buddha, the\nDhamma and Sangha is. Whatever, reverend sirs, has been spoken by Lord Buddha,\nall that is well-spoken. [37] I consider it proper, reverend sirs, to advise on\nhow the good Dhamma should last long.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">These Dhamma\ntexts\u2014Extracts from the Discipline, the Noble Way of Life, the Fears to Come,\nthe Poem on the Silent Sage, the Discourse on the Pure Life, Upatisa\u2019s Questions,\nand the Advice to Rahula which was spoken by the Buddha concerning false\nspeech\u2014these Dhamma texts, reverend sirs, I desire that all the monks and nuns\nmay constantly listen to and remember. [38] Likewise the laymen and laywomen. I\nhave had this written that you may know my intentions.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Seven Pillar Edicts<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">PE I<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Beloved-of-the-Gods\nspeaks thus: [39] This Dhamma edict was written twenty-six years after my\ncoronation. Happiness in this world and the next is difficult to obtain without\nmuch love for the Dhamma, much self-examination, much respect, much fear (of\nevil), and much enthusiasm. But through my instruction this regard for Dhamma\nand love of Dhamma has grown day by day, and will continue to grow. And my\nofficers of high, low and middle rank are practicing and conforming to Dhamma,\nand are capable of inspiring others to do the same. Mahamatras in border areas\nare doing the same. And these are my instructions: to protect with Dhamma, to\nregulate with Dhamma, to make happiness through Dhamma and to guard with\nDhamma.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">PE II<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Beloved-of-the-Gods,\nKing Piyadasi, speaks thus: Dhamma is good, but what constitutes Dhamma? (It\nincludes) little evil, much good, kindness, generosity, truthfulness and\npurity. I have given the gift of sight in various ways. [40] To two-footed and\nfour-footed beings, to birds and aquatic animals, I have given various things\nincluding the gift of life. And many other good deeds have been done by me.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">This Dhamma edict has\nbeen written that people might follow it and it might endure for a long time.\nAnd the one who follows it properly will do something good.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">PE III<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Beloved-of-the-Gods,\nKing Piyadasi, speaks thus: People see only their good deeds saying, \u201cI have\ndone this good deed.\u201d But they do not see their evil deeds saying, \u201cI have done\nthis evil deed\u201d or \u201cThis is called evil.\u201d But this (tendency) is difficult to\nsee. [41] One should think like this: \u201cIt is these things that lead to evil, to\nviolence, to cruelty, anger, pride and jealousy. Let me not ruin myself with\nthese things.\u201d And further, one should think: \u201cThis leads to happiness in this\nworld and the next.\u201d<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">PE IV<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Beloved-of-the-Gods\nspeaks thus: This Dhamma edict was written twenty-six years after my\ncoronation. My Rajjukas are working among the people, among many hundreds of\nthousands of people. The hearing of petitions and the administration of justice\nhas been left to them so that they can do their duties confidently and\nfearlessly and so that they can work for the welfare, happiness and benefit of\nthe people in the country. But they should remember what causes happiness and\nsorrow, and being themselves devoted to Dhamma, they should encourage the\npeople in the country (to do the same), that they may attain happiness in this\nworld and the next. These Rajjukas are eager to serve me. They also obey other\nofficers who know my desires, who instruct the Rajjukas so that they can please\nme. Just as a person feels confident having entrusted his child to an expert\nnurse thinking: \u201cThe nurse will keep my child well,\u201d even so, the Rajjukas have\nbeen appointed by me for the welfare and happiness of the people in the\ncountry.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The hearing of\npetitions and the administration of justice have been left to the Rajjukas so\nthat they can do their duties unperturbed, fearlessly and confidently. It is my\ndesire that there should be uniformity in law and uniformity in sentencing. I\neven go this far, to grant a three-day stay for those in prison who have been tried\nand sentenced to death. During this time their relatives can make appeals to\nhave the prisoners\u2019 lives spared. If there is none to appeal on their behalf,\nthe prisoners can give gifts in order to make merit for the next world, or\nobserve fasts. Indeed, it is my wish that in this way, even if a prisoner\u2019s\ntime is limited, he can prepare for the next world, and that people\u2019s Dhamma\npractice, self-control and generosity may grow.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">PE V<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Beloved-of-the-Gods,\nKing Piyadasi, speaks thus: Twenty-six years after my coronation various\nanimals were declared to be protected\u2014parrots, mynas, ruddy geese, swans, comb\nducks, mountain ducks, bats, queen ants, terrapins, boneless fish, hoodless\nsnakes, Gangetic dolphins, skates, tortoises, porcupines, squirrels, deer, freed\nbulls, household pets, wild asses, wild pigeons, domestic pigeons and all\nfour-footed creatures that are neither useful nor edible. [42] Those nanny\ngoats, ewes and sows which are with young or giving milk to their young are\nprotected, and so are young ones less than six months old. Cocks are not to be\ncaponized, husks hiding living beings are not to be burnt and forests are not\nto be burnt either without reason or to kill creatures. One animal is not to be\nfed to another. On the three fourth-month [full moon festival] days, the three\ndays of the Tishya constellation and during the Uposatha on the [dark and full\nmoon on the] fourteenth or fifteenth [day of the fortnight], fish are protected\nand not to be sold. During these days animals are not to be killed in the\nelephant reserves or the fish reserves either. On the eighth of every fortnight\n[of the moon-cycle], on the fourteenth and fifteenth [day of the fortnight], on\nthe day of the Tishya constellation, Punarvasu lunar mansion, the three\nfourth-month days and other auspicious days, bulls are not to be castrated,\nbilly goats, rams, boars and other animals that are usually castrated are not\nto be. On Tishya constellation days, Punarvasu lunar mansion day, the\nfourth-month full- and dark -moon day, horses and bullocks are not be branded.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In the twenty-six years\nsince my coronation prisoners have been given amnesty on twenty-five occasions.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">PE VI<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Beloved-of-the-Gods\nspeaks thus: Twelve years after my coronation I started to have Dhamma edicts\nwritten for the welfare and happiness of the people, and so that not\ntransgressing them they might grow in the Dhamma. Thinking: \u201cHow can the\nwelfare and happiness of the people be secured?\u201d I give attention to my\nrelatives, to those dwelling near and those dwelling far, so I can lead them to\nhappiness and then I act accordingly. I do the same for all groups. I have\nhonoured all religions with various honours. But I consider it best to meet\nwith people personally.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">This Dhamma edict was\nwritten twenty-six years after my coronation.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">PE VII<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Beloved-of-the-Gods\nspeaks thus: In the past kings desired that the people might grow through the\npromotion of the Dhamma. But despite this, people did not grow through the\npromotion of the Dhamma. Beloved-of-the-Gods, King Piyadasi, said concerning\nthis: \u201cIt occurs to me that in the past kings desired that the people might\ngrow through the promotion of the Dhamma. But despite this, people did not grow\nthrough the promotion of the Dhamma. Now how can the people be encouraged to\nfollow it? How can the people be encouraged to grow through the promotion of\nthe Dhamma? How can I elevate them by promoting the Dhamma?\u201d\nBeloved-of-the-Gods, King Piyadasi, further said concerning this: \u201cIt occurs to\nme that I shall have proclamations on Dhamma announced and instruction on\nDhamma given. When people hear these, they will follow them, elevate themselves\nand grow considerably through the promotion of the Dhamma.\u201d It is for this\npurpose that proclamations on Dhamma have been announced and various instructions\non Dhamma have been given and that officers who work among many promote and\nexplain them in detail. The Rajjukas who work among hundreds of thousands of\npeople have likewise been ordered: \u201cIn this way and that encourage those who\nare devoted to Dhamma.\u201d Beloved-of-the-Gods speaks thus: \u201cHaving this object in\nview, I have set up Dhamma pillars, appointed Dhamma Mahamatras, and announced\nDhamma proclamations.\u201d<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Beloved-of-the-Gods,\nKing Piyadasi, says: Along roads I have had banyan trees planted so that they\ncan give shade to animals and men, and I have had mango groves planted. At\nintervals of eight krosas, I have had wells dug, rest-houses built, and in\nvarious places, I have had watering-places made for the use of animals and men.\nBut these are but minor achievements. Such things to make the people happy have\nbeen done by former kings. I have done these things for this purpose, that the\npeople might practice the Dhamma.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Beloved-of-the-Gods,\nKing Piyadasi, speaks thus: My Dhamma Mahamatras too are occupied with various\ngood works among the ascetics and householders of all religions. I have ordered\nthat they should be occupied with the affairs of the Sangha. I have also\nordered that they should be occupied with the affairs of the Brahmans and the\nAjivikas. I have ordered that they be occupied with the Niganthas. [43] In\nfact, I have ordered that different Mahamatras be occupied with the particular\naffairs of all different religions. And my Dhamma Mahamatras likewise are\noccupied with these and other religions.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Beloved-of-the-Gods,\nKing Piyadasi, speaks thus: These and other principal officers are occupied\nwith the distribution of gifts, mine as well as those of the queens. In my\nwomen\u2019s quarters, they organize various charitable activities here and in the\nprovinces. I have also ordered my sons and the sons of other queens to\ndistribute gifts so that noble deeds of Dhamma and the practice of Dhamma may\nbe promoted. And noble deeds of Dhamma and the practice of Dhamma consist of\nhaving kindness, generosity, truthfulness, purity, gentleness and goodness\nincrease among the people.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Beloved-of-the-Gods,\nKing Piyadasi, speaks thus: Whatever good deeds have been done by me, those the\npeople accept and those they follow. Therefore they have progressed and will\ncontinue to progress by being respectful to mother and father, respectful to\nelders, by courtesy to the aged and proper behavior towards Brahmans and\nascetics, towards the poor and distressed, and even towards servants and\nemployees.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Beloved-of-the-Gods,\nKing Piyadasi, speaks thus: This progress among the people through Dhamma has\nbeen done by two means, by Dhamma regulations and by persuasion. Of these,\nDhamma regulation is of little effect, while persuasion has much more effect.\nThe Dhamma regulations I have given are that various animals must be protected.\nAnd I have given many other Dhamma regulations also. But it is by persuasion\nthat progress among the people through Dhamma has had a greater effect in\nrespect of harmlessness to living beings and non-killing of living beings.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Concerning this,\nBeloved-of-the-Gods says: Wherever there are stone pillars or stone slabs,\nthere this Dhamma edict is to be engraved so that it may long endure. It has\nbeen engraved so that it may endure as long as my sons and great-grandsons live\nand as long as the sun and the moon shine, and so that people may practice it\nas instructed. For by practicing it happiness will be attained in this world\nand the next.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">This Dhamma edict has\nbeen written by me twenty-seven years after my coronation.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Minor Pillar Edicts<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">1<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Twenty years after his\ncoronation, Beloved-of-the-Gods, King Piyadasi, visited this place and\nworshipped because here the Buddha, the sage of the Sakyans, was born. [44] He\nhad a stone figure and a pillar set up and because the Lord was born here, the\nvillage of Lumbini was exempted from tax and required to pay only one eighth of\nthe produce.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">2<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Beloved-of-the-Gods\ncommands: [45] The Mahamatras at Kosambi (are to be told: Whoever splits the\nSangha) which is now united, is not to be admitted into the Sangha. Whoever,\nwhether monk or nun, splits the Sangha is to be made to wear white clothes and\nto reside somewhere other than in a monastery. [46]<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: red; font-size: large;\"><b>James Princep was a\nBritish East India Employee of Rothschild engaged in the Opium business.</b></span><span style=\"font-size: small;\"><o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: red; font-size: large;\"><b><br /></b></span></span></div>\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n</div>\n<div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">So, so-- there was this\ncoup de grace in 1915, when our man James DISCOVERED an edict mentioning the\nname Asoka. The historians of Rothschild went around beating from the roof\ntops. And of course BR Ambedkar agreed with them.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<span style=\"color: blue; font-size: large;\"><b><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif;\"><span style=\"line-height: 150%;\">Some crooked translator\nof an ancient hoary script has been told to write <span style=\"background-color: yellow;\">DHAMMA </span>instead of DHARMA (\nthe corner stone of Hindusim ) and&nbsp;</span></span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif;\"><span style=\"line-height: 24px;\">Hinduism</span></span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif;\"><span style=\"line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;becomes Buddhism ?</span></span></b></span><br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: small;\"><span style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\nSorry, we do NOT have long ears !<o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Punch into Google\nsearch-<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: purple; font-size: large;\"><b>DHARMA IN HINDUISM\nVADAKAYIL</b></span><span style=\"font-size: small;\"><o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n</div>\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Buddhist scriptures\nof India and Sri Lanka do not talk about officials called Dharma Mahamatras in\nhis kingdom, as professed by the rock edicts.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Emperor Ashoka ( was\ncreated out of \u2018Devanampriya Priyadarshi\u2019). &nbsp;&nbsp;The wheel in the abacus of the pillar which\nhe erected as a memorial at Saranath , &nbsp;now\nadorns the national flag of free India.&nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://3.bp.blogspot.com/-5TQlWp-e7do/U-EEOF_JaTI/AAAAAAAAuOM/8Wp0J4knSA4/s1600/downleeoad.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"320\" src=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-5TQlWp-e7do/U-EEOF_JaTI/AAAAAAAAuOM/8Wp0J4knSA4/s1600/downleeoad.jpg\" width=\"320\" /></a></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The emblem of India is\nan adaptation of the Lion Capital of Ashoka at Sarnath.&nbsp; Emperor Ashoka the Great, guided by his first\nwife, Buddhist Queen Devi ( SIC ) , &nbsp;erected the capital to mark the spot where\nGautama Buddha first taught the Dharma -- nay- Dhammmmma&nbsp; , and where the Buddhist Sangha was founded. Oh\nboy !<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://3.bp.blogspot.com/-A6h8shB3ddM/U-EEB1vUMuI/AAAAAAAAuOE/Y_yya5d-egY/s1600/i-pillar.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"400\" src=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-A6h8shB3ddM/U-EEB1vUMuI/AAAAAAAAuOE/Y_yya5d-egY/s1600/i-pillar.jpg\" width=\"193\" /></a></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">There are NO Greek &nbsp;records &nbsp;about Chandra Gupta Maurya\u2019s grandson Emperor\nAshoka (whose kingdom was larger than Chandragupta's). We Indians never knew\nabout Ashoka , though we had to lump his chakra and his emblem.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">James Prinsep\ndeciphered Brahmi script script and was able to read the inscriptions of\nPiyadasi.</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://2.bp.blogspot.com/-7Ha56KDv41c/U-EEe852A-I/AAAAAAAAuOU/IEXwljkrjFw/s1600/imagffdes.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" src=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-7Ha56KDv41c/U-EEe852A-I/AAAAAAAAuOU/IEXwljkrjFw/s1600/imagffdes.jpg\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Why did he NOT leave a\ntranslator\u2019s guide? &nbsp;Why was this a big\nsecret ?<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">George Turnour found in\nthe Sri Lankan chronicles that Piyadasi was used as an alternate name for\nAsoka, grandson of Chandragupta Maurya&nbsp; .\nThis man just went to Sri lanka and created some FAKE documents.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">This man George\nTurnour, was a British civil servant. And a R historian. &nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;He was member of the Ceylon Civil Service. &nbsp;&nbsp;He is known for his translation of the\nMahavamsa, the Great Chronicle of bullsh#t&nbsp;\nSri Lankan history which was published in 1837.&nbsp; &nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Along with James\nPrinsep &nbsp;he began to decipher the\ninscriptions on the first discovered Pillar of Ashoka, the way it suited the\nwhite invader . An inscription with Piyadasi &nbsp;as a name for Asoka was not found until &nbsp;the Turnour's era.. <o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">We Indians do NOT need\nSri Lanka to know our own history.</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Henry Thomas Colebrooke\nhas written that &nbsp;pointed out that the\nGreek writers did not say anything about the Buddhist Bhikkhus (although it was\ntouted as a predominant religion of the time)<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n</div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">A major reason for\npainting Chanakya as a evil man without scruples and character is to show the\nworld that the Greek satraps who were ruling various kingdoms ( after\nAlexander\u2019s death ) were defeated by Chandra Gupta Maurya ONLY by deceit and\nguile\u2014 NOT honorable warfare .<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The truth is Chankaya\nadvocated moderation in material pleasures and strict adherence to the path of\nrighteousness. &nbsp;He himself set an example\nof shunning hedonism, and lived an exemplary life , refusing all adornments or\nriches even after establishing the first mighty Indian empire. &nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">His constant exhortation to give up sensory\npleasures, and cultivate qualities like kindness, patience etc may sound\nhypocritical coming from a man who overthrew governments. &nbsp;&nbsp;But there was NO hypocrisy here .&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Today in the internet age, Indian know his\ntimeless wisdom, his farsightedness, keenness of perception, and infallibility.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">There cooked up a FAKE\nstory that HINDU Ashoka had all his 99 brothers killed for the sake of the\nkingdom -- worse than the Islamic invaders.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">And Ashoka ruled a mighty empire. </span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">How come we Indian never heard of him, till\nthe white man came to India? And why do we have to learn of Indian history from\nBuddhist historical plays from Sri Lanka?</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">After the FAKE battle\nof Kalinga Asoka kicked away the BAAAD BAAAD hinduism and embraced PEACEFUL\nbuddhism. &nbsp;See Kancha Ilaiah will be so\nhappy.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Buddha's message of\nnonviolence, AHIMSA , kindness and love of mankind appealed to the unhappy\nHindu king Ashoka.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">A disciple of Buddha,\nUpagupta initiated him into Buddhism. &nbsp;From\nthat day Ashoka's heart became the home of compassion, right living, love and\nnonviolence. &nbsp;He gave up hunting and\neating meat. &nbsp;He put an end to the\nkilling of animals for the royal kitchen. &nbsp;Realizing that it was not enough if he lived a\nrighteous life, he proclaimed that all his subjects also should live a life of\nrighteousness. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The first thing our\nTURNED OVER A NEW LEAF Buddhist man Ashoka did was to spread righteousness\namong his people was to undertake a pilgrimage. &nbsp;It took place two years after the Kalinga war.\n&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">His pilgrimage started with his visit to\nSambodhi, the holy place where Gauthama, the Buddha breathed his last\u2014never mind\nthat Buddha existed in 1900 BC\u20141700 years before he was born.. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">For thirty-seven years\nAshoka ruled over a vast realm as an able emperor, a skilled lawgiver, a hero\nwho knew no defeat, a monk among the kings, a noble preacher of DhammMma and as a\nfriend of his subjects.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Oh BOY !<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Emperor Ashoka followed\nthe teachings of Buddhism so devotedly that he himself became a Buddhist monk. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">H.G.Wells, an English\nhistorian, has said, \"In the history of the world there have been\nthousands of kings and emperors who called themselves 'Their Highnesses',\n'Their majesties' and 'Their Exalted Majesties' and so on. They shone for a\nbrief movement and disappeared. &nbsp;But\nAshoka shines and shines brightly like a bright star even today.\" &nbsp;&nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">But hey, --</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">how come we\nIndians , who are the best ancient record keepers on this planet, &nbsp;never heard of him ? &nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">Acharya Hemachandra, following the\nearlier Gopala, presented an earlier version of the Fibonacci sequence. It was\npresented around 1150 AD, about fifty years before Fibonacci (1202). &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;He was considering the number of cadences of\nlength n, and showed that these could be formed by adding a short syllable to a\ncadence of length n \u2212 1, or a long syllable to one of n \u2212 2. &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;This recursion relation F(n) = F(n \u2212 1) +\nF(n \u2212 2) is what defines the Fibonacci sequence.&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">UNQUOTE <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Sorry, Italian\nFibonacci did NOT steal from a Jain monk in 1150 AD \u2014who did NOT know\nmathematics..
