, serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: x-large;\"><b style=\"background-color: yellow;\">Time to talk about Arthashasta.</b></span><span style=\"font-size: small;\"><o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Arthashastra\ncontains nearly 6000 sutras divided into 15 books, 150 chapters, and 180\nsections.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Arthashastra, ( 325\nBC ) of Kautilya is divided into 15 voluminous books:<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Concerning Discipline<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Duties of\nGovernment Superintendents<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Concerning Law<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Removal of Thorns<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Conduct of\nCourtiers<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Source of Sovereign\nStates<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The End of the Six-Fold\nPolicy<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Concerning Vices and\nCalamities<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Work of an Invader<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Relating to War<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Conduct of\nCorporations<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Concerning a Powerful\nEnemy<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Strategic Means to\nCapture a Fortress<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Secret Means<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Plan of a Treatise<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In a nutshell,&nbsp; Book 1 is on \u2018Fundamentals of Management\u2019,\nBook 2 deals with \u2018Economics\u2019, Books 3, 4 and 5 on \u2018Law\u2019, &nbsp;Books 6, 7 and 8 on Foreign Policies and Books\n9 to 14 deals with \u2018war\u2019. Book 15 deals with the methodology and devices used\nin writing the Arthashastra.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Artha, literally means\nwealth. &nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">But in the &nbsp;terms of Sanatana Dharma is NOT about wealth\nalone or materialistic accumulation.&nbsp; . &nbsp;Artha has to be seen from the perspective of a\nwisdom paradigm,&nbsp; the absolute, &nbsp;even the intangible , &nbsp;where it covers everything from money to\nknowledge to human spirit. Rather anything which is valuable to a human being \u2013nay--\nthe science of &nbsp;material happiness . &nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Arthashastra outlined a fair but strong system\nof governance for the betterment of public and equated the success of the king\nwith that of the public.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Money as beheld &nbsp;by number crunching monkeys , is NOT\neverything . &nbsp;It really takes an Indian\nDNA to understand this . &nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Wealth grabbing and\nnarrow minded Zionists will NEVER understand intangible hard to measure artha.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue; font-size: large;\"><b><br /></b></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue; font-size: large;\">Arthashastra is a mindboggling\ntreatise on mentoring of an inexperienced king instilling leadership spirit / royal\ndharma, participative governance, &nbsp;art of governance , economics, &nbsp;coinage, market regulation, how a state is to be\nrun, &nbsp;town building , public governance, state\nwelfare , medicare , social engineering, &nbsp;war strategies\n, international trade, commerce, taxation policy, treasury replenishment ,&nbsp; wage structures, HR management, &nbsp;change / time management, agriculture, banking\n, co-operative societies, &nbsp;demand and\nsupply , risk management, insurance, general and particular average, environment engineering, &nbsp;law making, human\nrights, &nbsp;entertainment for citizens, cultivable\nland distribution, effective / &nbsp;fair judiciary,\n&nbsp;court witness minimum qualifications, accountability\nof public officials, public transparency, &nbsp;inner democracy , checks/ controls/feedback , balance\nof quality versus quantity,&nbsp; weights /measures,\n&nbsp;passports, tolls, customs, taxation, free trade zones, consumer\nis king rights,&nbsp; natural resources\nmanagement, mining, crop patterns, animal husbandry, water management, weather data collection and prediction, irrigation, sanitation, legal agreements, &nbsp;partnership / joint ventures , building &nbsp;smart towns , innovation centres, &nbsp;fortifications, external espionage , internal spy network, and international relations.</span></i><span style=\"font-size: small;\"><o:p></o:p></span></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue; font-size: large;\"><br /></span></i></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: red; font-size: large;\"><b>Most of the administrative\nsuggestions prescribed by Chanakya in Arthashasta ( more than 6100 hymns ) are still relevant and practicable in the\nmodern administrative world--and have been lifted and adopted by the white man.</b></span><span style=\"font-size: small;\"><o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: red; font-size: large;\"><b><br /></b></span></span></div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://3.bp.blogspot.com/-vH-eD_3t_1U/U-I2SwWYAWI/AAAAAAAAuPE/Y6_mimajTlo/s1600/imagJYBFes.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"171\" src=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-vH-eD_3t_1U/U-I2SwWYAWI/AAAAAAAAuPE/Y6_mimajTlo/s1600/imagJYBFes.jpg\" width=\"400\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Chanakya wanted central\ncontrol of the State on almost all activities of governance. While the\nindividual merchants were free to continue, they had to comply with the\nauthorities appointed by the state. &nbsp;&nbsp;Kautilya\nhad appointed superintendents for almost every activity included in governance.\n&nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Arthashastra had given\ndue importance to passports. Every citizen had to carry a passport and this was\napplicable to the foreigners as well. Non compliance with this law led to a\nfine or imprisonment.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Arthashastra says &nbsp;\u201cArtisans shall, in accordance with their\nagreement as to time, place, and form of work, fulfil their engagements. Those\nwho postpone their engagements under the excuse that no agreement as to time,\nplace and form of work has been entered into shall, except in troubles and\ncalamities, not only forfeit \u00bcth of their wages, but also be punished with a\nfine equal to twice the amount of their wages. They shall also make good\nwhatever is thus lost or damaged. Those who carry on their work contrary to\norders shall not only forfeit their wages, but also pay a fine equal to twice\nthe amount of their wages.\u201d<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u201cPhysicians undertaking\nmedical treatment without intimating (to the government) the dangerous nature\nof the disease shall, if the patient dies, be punished with the first\namercement. If the death of a patient under treatment is due to carelessness in\nthe treatment, the physician shall be punished with the middle-most amercement.\nGrowth of disease due to negligence or indifference (karmavadha) of a physician\nshall be regarded as assault or violence.\u201d<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u201cThe Superintendent of\nCommerce shall allow the sale or mortgage of any old commodities (pur\u00e1na\nbh\u00e1ndan\u00e1m) only when the seller or mortgagor of such articles proves his\nownership of the same. With a view to prevent deception, he shall also\nsupervise weights and measures. Difference of half a pala in such measures as\nare called parim\u00e1n\u00ed and drona is no offence. But difference of a pala in them\nshall be punished with a fine of 12 panas. Fines for greater differences shall\nbe proportionally increased.\u201d<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u201cWhen a trader sells or\nmortgages inferior as superior commodities, articles of some other locality, as\nthe produce of a particular locality, adulterated things, or deceitful\nmixtures, or when he dexterously substitutes other articles for those just sold\n(samutparivartimam), he shall not only be punished with a fine of 54 panas but\nalso be compelled to make good the loss\u201d<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Arthashastra required\nthat a court must not allow a person with a criminal background to appear as a\nwitness. However, in India, we see FOREIGN MONEY being used to CREATE WITNESSES OUT\nOF THIN AIR to bail out terrorists and put even the Home Minister and DGP in jail.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">We see criminals being inducted into Rajya Sabha , hand kissers of\nforeign forces becoming state governors, and even PM / President.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Chanakya was the first\non this planet to envisage the concept of a \u2018nation\u2019.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Chanakya wanted\ncollection of the right amount of taxes at the right time from the right people.</span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\"Taxation\nshould not be a painful process for the people. There should be leniency and\ncaution while deciding the tax structure. Ideally, governments should collect\ntaxes like a honeybee, which sucks just the right amount of honey from the\nflower so that both can survive. Taxes should be collected in small and not in\nlarge proportions\".<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Chanakya allowed exemptions\nand tax waivers &nbsp;- In case of a widow\nwith children to look after, the transferred income due to the death of her\nhusband is exempt from taxation. In case of faulty rainfall or draught,\nagricultural produce is exempted from taxation. Taxes were exempted for heroic soldiers\nwith exemplary record. Taxes were exempted in case of serious medical illness. The\nfamily of martyrs in war did not have to pay taxes. Chanakya was fair and\ncompassionate , who felt the pulse of his citizens.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Chanakya knew that the\nmost important factor of a state\u2019s prosperity is dependant on foreign trade as\nwell as on domestic trade.&nbsp; It was the\nking\u2019s duty to promote trade and commerce by maintaining trade routes\nconnecting markets and industrial zones. &nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The state ensured that trade routes free of\nharassment by courtiers, state officials, thieves and frontier guards. &nbsp;The state kept a hawk\u2019s eye on corrupt traders,\n&nbsp;cartels who &nbsp;fixed &nbsp;prices to make excessive profits, hoarders and\nthose who dealt in stolen property. &nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">He\nprescribed heavy fines for discouraging such offences by traders and with a\nview to provide consumer protection. &nbsp;The\nlaw on dealings among private merchants included: (a) Selling on agency basis.\n(b) Revocation of contracts between traders. (c) Traders traveling together and\npooling their goods.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Foreign traders had to pay\na sum of money as a deposit in order to carry out business in the state. &nbsp;T</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">his kept a check on foreign desh\ndrohis who arrive to conduct business and destabilize the state </span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">( FDI you can call it today ).</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Foreign traders were\nNEVER given the same status as the local traders &nbsp;\u2014 unlike in modern India where these desh\ndrohi &nbsp;FDI bringing foreigner traders are\ngiven more privileges. Chanakya encouraged local exporters.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Import duties on\nforeign goods about &nbsp;20% of their value. &nbsp;Rome and Greece were &nbsp;the major trading partners &nbsp;of the Mauryan Empire. &nbsp;Silver, marble, &nbsp;chemicals, wine , olive oil etc &nbsp;were imported .&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Foreign merchants were not\nallowed to be sued by any parties for a commercial dispute. Only the local\npartner was allowed to be sued. &nbsp;There\nwas a threshold limit on profit . The usual permissible profit margin on\nimported goods was 10%. Foreign trade was conducted on a barter basis and NOT\non currency. &nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The State provided for the share of profits\npayable to the foreign king. All the expenses were calculated and the\nprofitability of the trade was determined in a honest and transparent manner.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Arthashastra encouraged\nprofitable trading . It did NOT advocate loss in trade even with a MFN\npartner.&nbsp; Traders were encourages to give\nsome concessions to MFN partners.&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u201cHaving ascertained the\nvalue of local produce as compared with that of foreign produce that can be\nobtained in barter, the superintendent will find out (by calculation) whether\nthere is any margin left for profit after meeting the payments (to the foreign\nking) such as the toll (sulka), road-cess (vartan\u00ed), conveyance- cess\n(\u00e1tiv\u00e1hika), tax payable at military stations (gulmadeya), ferry- charges\n(taradeya), subsistence to the merchant and his followers (bhakta), and the\nportion of merchandise payable to the foreign king (bh\u00e1ga). &nbsp;If no profit can be realised by selling the\nlocal produce in foreign countries, he has to consider whether any local\nproduce can be profitably bartered for any foreign produce. Then he may send\none quarter of his valuable merchandise through safe roads to different markets\non land. In view of large profits, he (the deputed merchant) may make\nfriendship with the forest guards, boundary-guards, and officers in charge of\ncities and of country-parts (of the foreign king). &nbsp;He shall take care to secure his treasure\n(s\u00e1ra) and life from danger. &nbsp;If he\ncannot reach the intended market, he may sell the merchandise (at any market)\nfree from all dues (sarvadeyavisuddham).\u201d<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Chankaya was the first\nto introduce risk management.&nbsp; Higher\nlevels of risk and uncertainty had to be compensated with higher levels of\nprofits. This is why he allowed 10% profits on imports while allowing only 5%\non local trade. This was because imports had element beyond the control of the\nstate , like goods getting stolen or damaged in transit. &nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u201cAn interest of a pana\nand a quarter per month per cent is just. Five panas per month per cent is\ncommercial interest (vy\u00e1vah\u00e1riki). Ten panas per month per cent prevails among\nforests. Twenty panas per month per cent prevails among sea-traders (s\u00e1mudr\u00e1n\u00e1m).\nPersons exceeding, or causing to exceed the above rate of interest shall be\npunished with the first amercement; and hearers of such transactions shall each\npay half of the above fine.\u201d &nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">This\nclearly shows that Kautilya has anointed riskier ventures with greater rates of\ninterest.&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Risk &nbsp;management, </span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">was centralized. Almost all insurance was\ntaken care of by the state. Private money lenders had to pay a sum of profits\non interests to the state. They were also entitled to a limit on the amount of\nmoney they lent. </span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">The private money\nlenders could also take up the risk for investments in merchandise. This right\nwas granted only to people with enough income to dispose off and they have to\nbe people of good character and families .&nbsp;</span></div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">All modern methods of lending\ninterest as a percentage were created 2400 years ago. &nbsp;Chanakya propounded six different kinds of\ninterests: compound interest, periodical interest, stipulated interest, daily\ninterest, and the use of a pledged article. &nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u201cThe nature of the\ntransactions between creditors and debtors, on which the welfare of the kingdom\ndepends, shall always be scrutinized. Interest in grains in seasons of good\nharvest shall not exceed more than half when valued in money. Interest on\nstocks (prakshepa) shall be one-half of the profit and be regularly paid as\neach year expires. If it is allowed to accumulate owing to the intention or to\nthe absence of the receiver or payer, the amount payable shall be equal to\ntwice the share or principal (m\u00falyadvigunah). A person claiming interest when\nit is not due, or representing as principal the total amount of his original\nprincipal and the interest thereon shall pay a fine of four times the amount\nunder dispute (bandhachaturgunah).\u201d <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Interest rates varied\nfrom 1.25% to 2% per month. The rate of interest depended upon the risk\ninvolved and the potential productivity of the money borrowed. The highest rate\nof interest was 20% per month and was charged to those involved in exports /\nimports.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u201cThose who can be\nexpected to relieve misery, who can give instructions to artisans, who can be\ntrusted with deposits, who can plan artistic work after their own design, and\nwho can be relied upon by guilds of artisans, may receive the deposits of the\nguilds. The guilds (sren\u00ed) shall receive their deposits back in time of\ndistress.\u201d&nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Agriculture was given\nmaximum state protection and sponsorship. Chanakya noted that&nbsp; cultivable land is better than mines because\nmines fill only the treasury while agricultural production fills both treasury\nand store houses.&nbsp;&nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u201cPossessed of the\nknowledge of the science of agriculture dealing with the plantation of bushes\nand trees (krishitantragulmavrikshsh\u00e1yurvedaj\u00f1ah), or assisted by those who are\ntrained in such sciences, the superintendent of agriculture shall in time\ncollect the seeds of all kinds of grains, flowers, fruits, vegetables, bulbous\nroots, roots, fiber producing plants, and cotton. He shall employ slaves,\nlabourers, and prisoners (dandapratikartri) to sow the seeds on crown-lands\nwhich have been often and satisfactorily ploughed. The work of the above men\nshall not suffer on account of any want in ploughs (karshanayantra) and other\nnecessary instruments or of bullocks. Nor shall there be any delay in procuring\nto them the assistance of blacksmiths, carpenters, borers (medaka), rope\nmakers, as well as those who catch snakes, and similar persons.\u201d</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Expert weather forecasters\nwere sponsored by the state. A good rainy season was when one-third of the\nannual rainfall occurs in the beginning and at the end of the season and\ntwo-thirds in the middle.</span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u201cThe quantity of rain\nthat falls in the country of j\u00e1ngala is 16 dronas; half as much more in moist\ncountries (an\u00fap\u00e1n\u00e1m); as to the countries which are fit for agriculture\n(d\u00e9sav\u00e1p\u00e1nam);--13\u00bd dronas in the country of asmakas; 23 dronas in avant\u00ed; and\nan immense quantity in western countries (apar\u00e1nt\u00e1n\u00e1m), the borders of the\nHimalayas, and the countries where water channels are made use of in\nagriculture (kuly\u00e1v\u00e1p\u00e1n\u00e1m). When one-third of the requisite quantity of rain falls\nboth during the commencement and closing months of the rainy season and\ntwo-thirds in the middle, then the rainfall is (considered) very even\n(sushum\u00e1r\u00fapam). A forecast of such rainfall can be made by observing the\nposition, motion, and pregnancy (garbh\u00e1d\u00e1na) of the Jupiter (Brihaspati), the\nrise and set and motion of the Venus, and the natural or unnatural aspect of\nthe sun. From the sun, the sprouting of the seeds can be inferred; from (the\nposition of) the Jupiter, the formation of grains (stambakarita) can be\ninferred; and from the movements of the Venus, rainfall can be inferred. Three\nare the clouds that continuously rain for seven days; eighty are they that pour\nminute drops; and sixty are they that with the sunshine-this is termed\nrainfall. Where rain, free from wind and unmingled with sunshine, falls so as\nto render three turns of ploughing possible, there, the reaping of good harvest\nis certain.\u201d&nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u201cAccording as the\nrainfall is more or less, the superintendent shall sow the seeds which require\neither more or less water. S\u00e1li (a kind of rice), vr\u00edhi (rice), kodrava\n(Paspalum Scrobiculatum), tila (sesame), priyangu (panic seeds), d\u00e1raka, and\nvaraka (Phraseolus Trilobus) are to be sown at the commencement (p\u00farv\u00e1v\u00e1pah) of\nthe rainy season. Mudga (Phraseolus Mungo), m\u00e1sha (Phraseolus Radiatus), and\nsaibya are to be sown in the middle of the season. Kusumbha (safflower), mas\u00fara\n(Ervum Hirsute), kuluttha (Dolichos Uniflorus), yava (barley), godh\u00fama (wheat),\nkal\u00e1ya (leguminous seeds), atasi (linseed), and sarshapa (mustard) are to be\nsown last. Or seeds may be sown according to the changes of the season. Fields\nthat are left unsown (v\u00e1p\u00e1tiriktam, i.e., owing to the inadequacy of hands) may\nbe brought under cultivation by employing those who cultivate for half the\nshare in the produce (ardhas\u00edtik\u00e1); or those who live by their own physical\nexertion (svav\u00edryopaj\u00edvinah)may cultivate such fields for \u00bcth or 1/5th of the\nproduce grown; or they may pay (to the king) as much as they can without\nentailing any hardship upon themselves (anavasitam bh\u00e1gam), with the exception\nof their own private lands that are difficult to cultivate.\u201d<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u201cThe superintendent\nshall grow wet crops (ked\u00e1ra), winter-crops (haimana), or summer crops\n(graishmika) according to the supply of workmen and water. Rice-crops and the\nlike are the best (jy\u00e1shtha, i.e., to grow); vegetables (shanda) are of\nintermediate nature; and sugarcane crops (ikshu) are the worst (pratyavarah,\ni.e., very difficult to grow), for they are subject to various evils and\nrequire much care and expenditure to reap. Lands that are beaten by foam\n(phen\u00e1gh\u00e1tah, i.e., banks of rivers, etc.) are suitable for growing vall\u00edphala\n(pumpkin, gourd and the like); lands that are frequently over flown by water\n(par\u00edv\u00e1h\u00e1nta) for long pepper, grapes (mridv\u00edk\u00e1), and sugarcane; the vicinity\nof wells for vegetables and roots; low grounds (harin\u00edparyant\u00e1h) for green\ncrops; and marginal furrows between any two rows of crops are suitable for the\nplantation of fragrant plants, medicinal herbs, cuscus roots (us\u00ednara), h\u00edra,\nberaka, and pind\u00e1luka (lac) and the like. Such medicinal herbs as grow in\nmarshy grounds are to be grown not only in grounds suitable for them, but also\nin pots (sth\u00e1lyam).\u201d<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;\u201cIrrigational works (s\u00e9tubandha) are the\nsource of crops; the results of a good shower of rain are ever attained in the\ncase of crops below irrigational works.\u201d</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u201cOf forts such as a\nfort on a plain, in the centre of a river, and on a mountain, that which is\nmentioned later is of more advantage than the one previously mentioned; of\nirrigational works (s\u00e9tubandha), that which is of perennial water is better\nthan that which is fed with water drawn from other sources; and of works\ncontaining perennial water, that which can irrigate an extensive area is\nbetter.\u201d&nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u201cIn case of construction of new works such as\ntanks, lakes, etc; taxes on the lands below such tanks) shall be remitted for\nfive years (Panchav\u00e1rshikah parih\u00e1rah). For repairing neglected or ruined works\nof similar nature, taxes shall be remitted for four years. For improving or\nextending water-works, taxes shall be remitted for three years. In the case of\nacquiring such newly started works by mortgage or purchase, taxes on the lands\nbelow such works shall be remitted for two years. If uncultivated tracts are\nacquired (for cultivation) by mortgage, purchase or in any other way, remission\nof taxes shall be for two years. Out of crops grown by irrigation by means of\nwind power or bullocks (v\u00e1tapravartimanandinibandh\u00e1yatana) or below tanks, in\nfields, parks, flower gardens, or in any other way, so much of the produce as\nwould not entail hardship on the cultivators may be given to the Government.\nPersons, who cultivate the lands below tanks, etc., of others at a stipulated\nprice (prakraya), or for annual rent (avakraya), or for certain number of\nshares of the crops grown (bh\u00e1ga) or persons who are permitted to enjoy such\nlands free of rent of any kind, shall keep the tanks, etc., in good repair;\notherwise they shall be punished with a fine of double the loss. Persons,\nletting out the water of tanks, etc., at any other place than their sluice gate\n(ap\u00e1re), shall pay a fine of 6 panas;and persons who recklessly obstruct the\nflow of water from the sluice- gate of tanks shall also pay the same fine.\u201d</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u201cThe seeds of grains\nare to be exposed to mist and heat (tush\u00e1rap\u00e1yanamushnam cha) for seven nights;\nthe seeds of kosi are treated similarly for three nights; the seeds of\nsugarcane and the like (k\u00e1ndab\u00edj\u00e1nam) are plastered at the cut end with the\nmixture of honey, clarified butter, the fat of hogs, and cow dung; the seeds of\nbulbous roots (kanda) with honey and clarified butter; cotton seeds (asthib\u00edja)\nwith cow dung; and water pits at the root of trees are to be burnt and manured\nwith the bones and dung of cows on proper occasions.\u201d<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n</div>\n</div>\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In India agriculture is\ncompletely out of the purview of the tax regime . The farmers get free\nelectricity. Using this concession sugar cane barons are minting money. Sugar\ncane is water intensive. Yet these barons lower the ground water level to make biofuel\nand alcohol rum. Maharashtra farmer keep committing suicide.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Arthashastra has taxed\nagriculture and allied activities (though it was one of the sole major sectors\ncontributing to state welfare).</span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Chanakya was NOT in\nfavour of too strong a centre. He wanted that people should be given rights and\nresponsibilities such that they actively participate in the running of the\nstate. But important powers were held by the centre.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">The public sector acted\nas a regulator of all economic activities in the society. The state allowed\nmany private sectors to flourish. </span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">This\nwas done under the surveillance of the public sector which was run by the\nState. </span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">The private players were given\npermission to take part in the economy only after verifications of their desh\nbhakti and ability to deliver the goods.</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">All barren and\nunoccupied lands were controlled by the state. The ownership of unclaimed land\nwas with the state. The State regularly leased land for peasants and the\nunderprivileged for farming, for setting up businesses or for building\nsettlements. He tenants had to pay a nominal sum of money to the state as fees.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Mining and fishing were predominantly controlled by the State. However, the\nState also allowed private sectors to carry out this trade by paying a trade\ntax to the State. &nbsp;Salt pans worked under\nthe complete authority of the State.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Manufacture and sale of\nwas the State\u2019s monopoly. &nbsp;Any person\ninvolved in this was severely punished.&nbsp; The\nState private sector to handle animal husbandry .&nbsp; Forestry and mining were monopolies of the\nState. &nbsp;Forest superintendents were\nappointed by the State to protect wildlife and precious wood and produce.</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Arthashastra gives tips\non human resource management which is applicable even today- recruitment and\nselection, organizational design , change management, time management, performance\nappraisals, employee relation, compensation, rewards, training , mentoring , bonuses etc.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Arthashastra identifies\nfour kinds of people who could be lured; the angry, the timid, the greedy and\nthe proud. &nbsp;These are the four basic\nbehaviours which could lead to one\u2019s downfall. There were comprehensive methods\nwho to lure such groups of people. The proud were given an ego massage.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Wages should be high\nenough to maintain the loyalty of the officials, to evoke the needed efficiency\nand to reflect the relative importance of their occupation. &nbsp;Wages were mostly based on performance and skill\ninvolved. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u201cThe artisans employed\nin the office shall do their work as ordered and in time. When under the excuse\nthat time and nature of the work has not been prescribed, they spoil the work,\nand they shall not only forfeit their wages, but also pay a fine of twice the\namount of their wages. When they postpone work, they shall forfeit one- fourth\nthe amount of their wages and pay a fine of twice the amount of the forfeited\nwages. Those women who can present themselves at the weaving house shall at\ndawn be enabled to exchange their spinning for wages (bh\u00e1ndavetanavinimayam).\u201d<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;\u201cDelay in paying the wages shall be punished\nwith the middlemost amercement. The same would be the case when wages are paid\nfor work that is not completed.\u201d <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u201cDisputes regarding\nwages shall be decided on the strength of evidences furnished by witnesses. In\nthe absence of witnesses, the master who has provided his servant with work\nshall be examined.\u201d <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;\u201cFailure to pay wages shall be punished with a\nfine of ten times the amount of wages (dasabandhah), or 6 panas;\nmisappropriation of wages shall be punished with a fine of 12 panas or of five\ntimes the amount of the wages (panchabandho v\u00e1).\u201d <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u201cA worker neglecting or\nunreasonably putting off work for which he has received wages shall be fined 12\npanas and be caught-hold of till the work is done. He who is incapable to turn\nout work, or is engaged to do a mean job, or is suffering from disease, or is\ninvolved in calamities shall be shown some concession or allowed to get the\nwork done by a substitute. The loss incurred by his master or employer owing to\nsuch delay shall be made good by extra work.\u201d<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n</div>\n</div>\n</div>\n</div>\n</div>\n<div>\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;\u201cAssisted by his prime minister (mantri) and\nhis high priest, the king shall, by offering temptations, examine the character\nof ministers (am\u00e1tya) appointed in government departments of ordinary nature.\nOf these tried ministers, those whose character has been tested under religious\nallurements shall be employed in civil and criminal courts\n(dharmasthan\u00edyakantaka sodhaneshu); those whose purity has been tested under\nmonetary allurements shall be employed in the work of a revenue collector and\nchamberlain; those who have been tried under love-allurements shall be\nappointed to superintend the pleasure-grounds (vih\u00e1ra) both external and\ninternal; those who have been tested by allurements under fear shall be\nappointed to immediate service; and those whose character has been tested under\nall kinds of allurements shall be employed as prime ministers (mantrinah),\nwhile those who are proved impure under one or all of these allurements shall\nbe appointed in mines, timber and elephant forests, and manufactories.\u201d <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;\u201cTeachers have decided that in accordance with\nascertained purity, the king shall employ in corresponding works those ministers\nwhose character has been tested under the three pursuits of life, religion,\nwealth and love, and under fear.\u201d<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\"In the happiness\nof the subjects lays the happiness of the king and in what is beneficial to the\nsubjects his own benefit. What is dear to the king is not beneficial to him,\nbut what is dear to the subjects is beneficial to him\"<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The qualities of a good\nleader include: (a) Piety; (b) Truthfulness; (c) Reliability; (d) Gratefulness;\n(e) Liberality; (f) Promptness; (g) Freedom from vices; (h) Long term vision;\n(i) Conduct in conformity with the advice of elders. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;\u2018The leader with his senses under control must\navoid doing injury to others, sloth, capriciousness, association with harmful\npersons and any transaction associated with unrighteousness or harm.\u201d <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u201cThe king should be\never active to carry out the management of material wellbeing, which will in\nturn lead to spiritual wellbeing and happiness.\u201d <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u201cThe king should avoid even a big profit that\nwould be injurious to the subjects.\u201d</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In his war strategies against\nexternal threats Chanakya &nbsp;lays down methods\nof sabotage, instilling awe, &nbsp;demoralization,\n&nbsp;disappointment and loss of confidence\namong the enemy ranks, prior to launching a full-scale assault on the enemy bastion.&nbsp; Methods of how to weaken an enemy\u2019s resolve\nby cutting off food , water and supply lines was laid down.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Arthashastra regarding\nspying as an indispensable and integral part of an efficient administration and\nof a sound foreign policy. &nbsp;It gave true feedback\nto the king of the activities, afflictions, and operations of political\nadversaries: their disloyal and disgruntled elements, fifth columnists and\nforeign agents in their midst, also the strength and intentions of all foreign\npower.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Arthasastra mentions two wings of \u2018secret service\u2019, viz. \u2018samstha\u2018\nand \u2018sancara\u2018. The agents belonging to \u2018samstha\u2019 were stationed in the\nEstablishment financed by the State, whereas the \u2018sancaras\u2019 moved from place to\nplace depending on dynamics and professional requirements. The spymasters of\nthe two wings headed their respective cadre of agents, and controlled their\noperations. The members of one group were not aware of the existence of the\nother.&nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n</div>\n</div>\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: cyan; font-size: large;\"><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\">Launching into too much\ndetail is beyond the scope of this post. &nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\">The few passages above above is just for the\nreader to get a feel , </span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\">of how a genius mind\nworked 2400 years ago.</span></span></div>\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Arthashastra is fruit\nof</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp; </span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">practical experience of running a\nstate. </span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">It is not just a normative text\nbut a realist description of the art of running a state.</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Arthashastra takes into\naccount political realism .&nbsp; He believed that\npolitics, like society in general, is governed by objective laws that have\ntheir roots in human nature. Political realism avoids reinterpreting reality to\nfit the policy. &nbsp;A good foreign policy\nminimizes risks and maximizes benefits. Political realism is aware of the moral\nsignificance of political action. It is also aware of the tension between the\nmoral command and the requirements of successful political action.&nbsp; &nbsp;Political realism is based on a pluralistic\nconception of human nature.&nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Chanakya &nbsp;decries that the primary duty of a king is to\nprotect \"Dharma\" or righteousness in society. &nbsp;That king who upholds righteousness and virtue\nwill have happiness in this world and also in the next. &nbsp;Chanakya declared that a king who uses his\npower improperly and unjustly &nbsp;deserves\nto be punished.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">\"The happiness of\nthe commoners is the happiness of the king. Their welfare is his welfare. A\nking should never think of his personal interest or welfare, but should try to\nfind his joy in the joy of his subjects.\" \u2013these are written words of\nChanakya.</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Arthashastra envisioned\n-</span></div>\n</div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">A self sufficient\nagriculture based economy which is not dependent on foreign trade. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">An egalitarian society\nwhere there are equal opportunities for all. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">A cultured society\nwhere the people are not running behind material pleasures--where there is\ncontrol over the sense organs-- where there is spiritual development is\nessential for the internal strength and character of the individual.&nbsp;&nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The diplomatic enclave\nin New Delhi is named Chanakyapuri in honour of Chanakya. Institutes named\nafter him include Training Ship Chanakya, Chanakya National Law University and\nChanakya Institute of Public Leadership.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Alexander the great was\nbuilt up by Greek poets and the oracles at Delphi as an invincible hero like\nAchilles.</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp; </span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">It was pathetic to see him\neven unable to fight without his horse Buecephalus.</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp; </span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">When he was wounded it became clear to the\nGreek soldier that his hero is NO longer invincible and he was just an ordinary\nmoral.</span></div>\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">You will be surprised\nto note that strategies &nbsp;of ultra modern\nespionage, &nbsp;and intelligence agencies are\nstill based on the tips of Chanakya.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;\nThe Arthashastra identifies its author by the name Kautilya, except for\nonce by the name Vishnugupta ( who was just a copier abridger ). <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Why Kautilya ? -\nChanakya him self admitted that I am honest with the honest and Vajra Kutil\n(cunning) with the Kutil,&nbsp;&nbsp; thus he was\nnicknamed Kautilya.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; named Mura and spent his\nchildhood in the Nanda palace. The Nanda king has enrolled his illegitimate son\nat Taxila as soon as he reached the university admission age of 16.</span></div>\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The white historian &nbsp;LIED&nbsp; that\nChanakya made Chandragupta ( Sandakottus or was it bandrakottus ?) &nbsp;join Alexander and become one of his ARMY Lieutenants.&nbsp; Why should he do that when he was already\nking ? &nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Oh blimey , xcuze\npleajjje \u2013 I forgot that Chandragupta Maurya learnt the art of warfare from the\nGreekos \u2014and what about culture ? &nbsp;What\nabout soap , pray ? &nbsp;Because soap is civilization,\nright ?&nbsp; What about toilet paper, &nbsp;prithee &nbsp;?,&nbsp;</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The white invader says\nthat Ashoka is said to be the son of queen Durdhara. &nbsp;See they know everything !<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n</div>\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In the present day\nworld, Taxila is situated in Pakistan at a place near Rawalpindi. The university\naccommodated more than 10,000 students at a time. The university offered\ncourses spanning a period of more than eight years.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The students were mostly admitted\nafter graduating from their own countries. &nbsp;Aspiring students opted for elective subjects\ngoing for in depth studies in specialized branches of learning.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; line-height: 150%; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://4.bp.blogspot.com/-Pezc1TXufgg/U-RpwPn7CFI/AAAAAAAAuSY/AkZDhPuulgc/s1600/taxffrila.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"306\" src=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-Pezc1TXufgg/U-RpwPn7CFI/AAAAAAAAuSY/AkZDhPuulgc/s1600/taxffrila.jpg\" width=\"400\" /></a></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The FAKE historians try\nto convince us that Ashoka really existed.&nbsp;\n\u201c Dasaratha Maurya was the Emperor of the Mauryan dynasty from 232 BCE\nto 224 BCE. According to the Matsya Purana, he succeeded his grandfather Ashoka\nthe Great. He succeeded Ashoka after his uncle Kunala became blind, which made\nhim unfit to rule&nbsp;(sic)&nbsp;\u201d&nbsp;.&nbsp;\nWhat a sick joke\u2014Matsya Purana was written thousands of years before the\ndate they refer to.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The range of subjects\ntaught in the university of Taxila were math, astronomy, economics, geography,\nsurgery, ayurveda, physics, chemistry, astrology, statecraft ( for princes ), agriculture,\nmartial arts, &nbsp;philosophy, commerce , law\netc..<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Patliputra had another\ngreat University named Nalanda. Chankaya used to travel from Taxila to Nalanda\nas a much sought after visiting professor\u2014such was his fame .&nbsp; The Chinese traveler Fahian, who visited the\ncity in 399 AD described it as prosperous city endowed with rich natural\nresources.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Long before Clausewitz\ncame up with the quote, which said \"War is only the continuance of state\npolicy by other means\",&nbsp; &nbsp;Chanakya had already written it in his book\n\u2018Nitishastra \u2019. &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Most of his views were\nso amazing and farsighted that they appeared to be prophesies for future times .<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot;
