Ajit Vadakayil", "url": "https://www.blogger.com/profile/14410812789424637654", "image": {"url": "//4.bp.blogspot.com/-QSnd-Z8F7Kc/XFtPudWdwlI/AAAAAAABfq4/vxrkFOO7Iu8Mf6-OaPgw6FPpRDSmMgLdgCK4BGAYYCw/s35/capt%25252BajitC%25252Bvadakayil.JPG"}}, "replies": {"totalItems": "463", "selfLink": "https://www.googleapis.com/blogger/v3/blogs/3564735312144269387/posts/7105893338504008155/comments"}}, {"kind": "blogger#post", "id": "9069701357574778828", "blog": {"id": "3564735312144269387"}, "published": "2014-07-21T20:39:00+05:30", "updated": "2014-08-01T01:41:39+05:30", "etag": "\"iHf3yWDE_geBgZ8U7rgZ_xuTeAQ/dGltZXN0YW1wOiAxNDA2ODM3NDk5NzQ3Cm9mZnNldDogMTk4MDAwMDAK\"", "url": "http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.com/2014/07/tank-cleaning-tips-for-special-cargoes.html", "selfLink": "https://www.googleapis.com/blogger/v3/blogs/3564735312144269387/posts/9069701357574778828", "title": "TANK CLEANING TIPS FOR  SPECIAL CARGOES ON CHEMICAL TANKERS \u2013 CAPT AJIT VADAKAYIL", "content": "<div dir=\"ltr\" style=\"text-align: left;\" trbidi=\"on\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://3.bp.blogspot.com/-9Ka3LoxH8Xc/U80sedRNXSI/AAAAAAAAt08/8smi8W_sW6U/s1600/doweenload.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" src=\"http://3.bp.blogspot.com/-9Ka3LoxH8Xc/U80sedRNXSI/AAAAAAAAt08/8smi8W_sW6U/s1600/doweenload.jpg\" /></a></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Cargoes consisting of\nmixtures with different vapour pressures should be not be cleaned by\nevaporation or hot pre-washed.. The evaporation of the light substances from\nthe mixture will result in non-volatile residues which are very difficult to\nremove.</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">For cleaning LSHWFO\ntanks , first prewash with moderate warm water, followed by a recirc with gas\noil.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">After Slack Wax ( high\nMP paraffin ) , steam the tank hot, &gt;20C above the MP of the wax, and then\nwash with hot sea water. &nbsp;Use Graco (\nbarrel pump) injection method with emulsifier. &nbsp;However with Refined Wax ( paraffin with low\noil content ) , ensure the temp is &lt; 20bdeg C&nbsp;<span style=\"font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">above</span><span style=\"font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp; </span><span style=\"font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">the MP of wax, or you will get white</span><span style=\"font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp; </span><span style=\"font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">powdery</span><span style=\"font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;\n</span><span style=\"font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">residues. </span><span style=\"font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Use Graco injection\nmethod with emulsifier.</span><!--20c--><!--20c--><!--20c--></span><br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">After mineral Lub Oils\nthe best chemical to use would be a 75% emulsifier + 25% Surfactant\nmixture-like Sea Clean -with a low aromatic content , after a very hot prewash.\n. The first act would be to lower the BP of Lube oil from 250 deg C to less\nthan 100 deg C.</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Do not give hot prewash\nto kerosene.&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">For gasoil as warm\nprewash of &lt; 50 deg C is the best .<!--50c--><!--50--></span><br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">When cleaning animal /\nveg oils use water and detergent. Or use Caustic Potash. Avoid Caustic Soda and\nsea water ( stubborn white deposits ).</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Fatty acid oils is a\ndifficult cargo to clean. &nbsp;For Palm oil\nFatty acids, use hot FRESHWATER ( NEVER SEAWATER ) , 25 deg C above MP for\nprewash after steaming tank. &nbsp;If you\ndon\u2019t have FW use hardness treated seawater, to prevent white sticky residues\nof Calcium and Magnesium soaps . Heat increases these reactions: a 10\u00b0C\nincrease in temperature doubles the chemical reaction rate. &nbsp;The best method for pre-cleaning is to prepare\nthe required amount of freshwater in a separate and clean tank and to add a\nsuitable water hardness remover. &nbsp;If\nseawater or untreated freshwater must be used for cleaning, the formation of\nwhite residues or a white powdery film cannot be avoided .<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In SS tank the white\nsticky residues can be removed by diluted Phosphoric or Nitric acid.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">An effective preclean\nmethod for non drying fats is to steam the tanks for a short time prior to\ntankcleaning with hotwater.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<object class=\"BLOGGER-youtube-video\" classid=\"clsid:D27CDB6E-AE6D-11cf-96B8-444553540000\" codebase=\"http://download.macromedia.com/pub/shockwave/cabs/flash/swflash.cab#version=6,0,40,0\" data-thumbnail-src=\"https://ytimg.googleusercontent.com/vi/Ae9jwKTINcU/0.jpg\" height=\"266\" width=\"320\"><param name=\"movie\" value=\"https://youtube.googleapis.com/v/Ae9jwKTINcU&source=uds\" /><param name=\"bgcolor\" value=\"#FFFFFF\" /><param name=\"allowFullScreen\" value=\"true\" /><embed width=\"320\" height=\"266\"  src=\"https://youtube.googleapis.com/v/Ae9jwKTINcU&source=uds\" type=\"application/x-shockwave-flash\" allowfullscreen=\"true\"></embed></object></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Chemicals that tend to\npolymerize (Isoprene, vinyl, vinylidene, acrylic, or carbonyl compounds,\nstyrene, butadiene , ethylene oxide, propylene oxide, ethylene, propylene,\nisobutylene) require cold (ambient) water. Washing with hot water will result\nin stubborn polymeric residues left behind in tanks and lines. To avoid any\npolymerization by loss of inhibitor-protection, it is also recommended to wash\nimmediately after discharge .<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Styrene is soluble in\nEthanol, Methanol, Ether and Carbon di Sulphide.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Lub oil additives :\nECA, HITEC, OLOA, Paranox, TLA, LOA, Lubaol, Lubizol, Parabar, Sap etc. Avoid\nprewash with water after Lub oil additives , instead recirc 3 cum gas oil at\n50C. &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Later do a hot butterworth at 80\ndeg C and then use a degreaser. If you use hot water first there will be a\nvarnish Urethane residue.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Do not mix different\ngrades of clay slurry. &nbsp;These are held in\nsuspension and there will be a reaction between cationic and anionic products. &nbsp;If the slurry hardens and dries acid wash with\n10% Nitric acid&nbsp;&nbsp;( SS ).<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Odour sensitive cargoes\nare Glycol, Glycerine, Veg oils, White spirit etc. Strong odour cargoes are\nAcrylates, Phenol, Fish oil, Molasses, Tall oil , Piridine etc.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Sea water has 33000 ppm\nof salt or chlorides. Or 2.8% by weight. For Methanol the WWT passes for\nchlorides at 2.0 ppm CL. For MEG FG ( UCC ) the passing limit is 0.249 ppm\nwhich is ridiculous indeed. But if you want to pass the test and load the cargo\nyou have to comply with the specs.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">After dischg of drying\noils like Soyabean or Linseed oil give a cold prewash. These drying oils if\nwashed with hot water leave a stubborn varnish.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Always prewash\ninhibited cargoes with cold water. Products containing inhibitors must be\nwashed thoroughly<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Chemicals like Acetic\nacid, Benzene, Lun oils, Caustic soda, Paraffun, Molasses, Phenol, DINP, Fatty\nAlcohols, HMD, HITEC, WPAC, Butyl Acrylate, Creasote oil etc can be HOT\nprewashed.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">For DOP and DIDP give\nambient prewash.</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n</div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://3.bp.blogspot.com/-wPqQUPNxU8o/U9qi3igtNJI/AAAAAAAAuI4/fQGswSKUgEQ/s1600/TankJet-360.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" src=\"http://3.bp.blogspot.com/-wPqQUPNxU8o/U9qi3igtNJI/AAAAAAAAuI4/fQGswSKUgEQ/s1600/TankJet-360.jpg\" height=\"400\" width=\"359\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Cargoes which cannot be\nwashed with water are TDI, MDI, Slack wax, Coal tar, LO additives etc<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Fresh water prewash is\ngiven for Wet phosphoric acid and Sulphuric acid.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">After washing Esters /\nAcetates and halogenated HC which can form acids when mixed with water, the\nslops must not be allowed to stay in the tank.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">After inhibited cargo\neg Styrene, Acrylates etc always check PV valve. As cargo vapor can polymerise\non flame screen/valve seat and also give off odour too.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Cargoes which are\ncrystals in their pure form and are carried in solution such as caustic soda\nshould be washed with a water temperature corresponding to, or slightly above,\nthe discharge temperature.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Cargoes such as\nAlcohols and Ketones do not require extensive machine washing and can be\ncleaned by giving a short fresh water wash.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Cargoes such as Esters,\nAcetates and Halogenated hydrocarbons can form mineral or organic acids when\nmixed with water. To prevent any damage to coated tanks the water/slop must not\nbe allowed to stay in the tank during or after the tank cleaning program.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://4.bp.blogspot.com/--qVnx8Ukogg/U89BiKZLuXI/AAAAAAAAt1o/D8bgl4ZiUyg/s1600/imgggages.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" src=\"http://4.bp.blogspot.com/--qVnx8Ukogg/U89BiKZLuXI/AAAAAAAAt1o/D8bgl4ZiUyg/s1600/imgggages.jpg\" height=\"299\" width=\"400\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Cargoes belonging to\nthe Olefin, Phthalate, Adiptate, Fatty acid and Fatty alcohol categories are\ndifficult to clean. When the subsequent cargo requires a high degree of\ncleanliness (wall wash), alternative stowages should be carefully evaluated.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Some lube additives\ncontain organic acids which react with hot water. The introduction of hot water\ncan also cause jells to form on the tank, pump and line systems.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Lube oils with low viscosities\ncan be extremely hard to remove, especially from inorganic (zinc) coatings.\nGenerally if the viscosity is less than 100 cst and the subsequent cargo is of\nhigh specification, it may be necessary to toluene float the tank. Obtain the\nviscosity at the load port to assist in cleaning the tank after discharge.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Ventilation procedures\ncannot be used for products which contain an inhibitor such as Vinyl acetate as\nthe inhibitor does not evaporate.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">White residues after\namines can be removed by 3% Phosphoric acid plus 0.5% emulsifier.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">After clay slurry\nrecirc with dilute Nitric acid.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">White residues after\npolyol can be removed by Acetone or MEK.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">After dischg Isocyanate\ntanks have to be washed with non reactive solvent like chlorinated solvents and\nNEVER water. The urethane layer which forms will be very difficult to remove.\nIsocyanates (MDI/TDI) must never come into contact with water, nor must their\nresidues, because the reaction product and insoluble urethane are very\ndifficult to remove. MDI or TDI is cleaned best by Methylene Chloride.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://4.bp.blogspot.com/-qg0yOc1vKTM/U89Ax4lGJyI/AAAAAAAAt1c/uHmWC_2gN1o/s1600/fig102_cc01.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" src=\"http://4.bp.blogspot.com/-qg0yOc1vKTM/U89Ax4lGJyI/AAAAAAAAt1c/uHmWC_2gN1o/s1600/fig102_cc01.jpg\" height=\"147\" width=\"320\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Water reactive\nchemicals and products that must not come into contact with water must be\nwashed with a suitable solvent which does not contain any water. Cleaning is\ncarried out with a suitable solvent (e.g. butyl glycol ether, methanol,\nacetone, toluene, or 50/50 v/v mixtures of methanol and acetone)<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">After Latex, keep tank\nmoist with steam before you can prewash with FW .&nbsp; &nbsp;NEVER\nEVER allow tank to dry. &nbsp;&nbsp;If it is\ndifficult to peel off Latex, you can use Perchloroethylene.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">After Coal tar prewash\nwith Creosote at 60C . &nbsp;&nbsp;Then recirc Coal\ntar cleaner 1:5 . Further cleaning can be done with Toluene in inerted tank.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">To remove lead of\nLeaded Gasolene from coatings use \u201clead clean\u201d tank cleaning chemical<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">After hydrocracker,\nimmediately fill up the tank with one foot water and then heat up to about 65\ndeg C. then wash with very hot water. Then use an emulsifier.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">EDC discolouration can\nbe removed by Phosphoric acid ..<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Discoloration of the\ntank or the coating can be removed by the \u201cdye out\u201d method. It can be removed\nby spraying or recirculation with 0.5 to 2 percent sodium hypochlorite\nsolution. If this does not work, steaming or solvent steaming could help.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Aldehydes and Ketones\nthough water soluble leave traces in the vapor spaces and pipelines and are\nunsuitable prior cargoes like HMD.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">To neutralize the smell\nof some chemicals (Acrylates, Crude \u2018Turpentine, NitroBenzene, Pygas etc),\nsmell killers are used. Ex:-- P3/NA Henkel(CP), Airfresh (Vecom), Nilodor ,\nbleach or an alcohol will help neutralize the smell. After the carriage of a\nproduct with a strong odor and prior to loading a sensitive cargoes the seals\nof tank and butterworth hatches maybe have to be renewed / exchanged. Odour\nwill probably still be present after cleaning eg Acrylates, Butanol,\nEthyl-Hexyl-Alcohols, Styrene etc so remove gaskets on tank hatch and tank\ncleaning hatches and clean in Toluene (or replace if bad condition. To remove\nstrong odour from tank you can recirc with Caustic soda at 60 deg C. A smell\nkiller can be used in combination with a emulsifier. The tank should be cleaned\nby recirculation to ensure full removal of the odour-producing cargo.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">After Pyridine bases\ncargoes first hot wash, then recirc Caustic 2 %.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Toluene wiping of tanks\nmust be done with chemical resistant sponges.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Metalbrite is\nphosphoric acid plus non ionic surfactants. For pickling of severely corroded\nsurfaces use neat or 50%. When injected to remove white residue from epoxy 5%.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Ambient is &lt; 30 C<!--30--><!--30--><!--30--><!--30--></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Warm is &nbsp;&lt; &nbsp;60 C<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Hot is &nbsp;&gt; 60 C<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">For steam atomisation\nbuy a small portable steam ejector. This is about 5 inches long.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Volatile substances are\nmore soluble in cold water than in hot water. Do not allow tankcleaning\nchemicals to dry up on the tank bulkheads .<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Some Lube oil additives\nrequires wash with MDO &nbsp;&lt; 50 deg C or kerosene or hot base oil &nbsp;&gt; 60 deg C <!--50--></span><span style=\"font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">direct after discharge,&nbsp; before starting\nhot water wash.&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp; Sometimes a solvent is\ncombined with an emulsifying cleaning agent (mixture of solvent, surface active\nagents and additives)</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><o:p></o:p><!--50c--></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Some Lub oil additives\nreact with hot water to leave a sticky residue all over. Test it inside a\ndrained sample bottle. Some highly viscous cargoes (lube additives or polyols)\n, will have have undesired reactions at higher temperatures, hence it is necessary\nto pre clean with ambient water. .<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Morocco Phosphoric\nAcid. After the usual washing, hard concrete like layers remain on horizontals\nwhich do not go with kew machine. Recirculation with diluted clean Phosphoric\nAcid will work\u2014use filters to prevent clogging of BW machines.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Sodium silicate\nsolutions should be washed only with Fresh water and NOT with seawater. Calcium\nand magnesium silicates formed with salt water are very difficult to remove.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Gas oil can be used to\nprewash luboil additives.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Fish Oil is an\noxidizing oil, and a drying oil. It should never be prewashed hot. Commence\nprewash<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">as soon as possible\nafter discharge. Remove hot interface.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">After Slack Wax , steam\nthe tank hot, &gt; 20 &nbsp;deg C above the MP of the wax, and then wash with hot sea\nwater.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Use Graco injection\nmethod with emulsifier. &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;However with refines wax, ensure the temp is\n&lt; 20C above the MP of wax, or you will get white powdery residues.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Coal tar and creosote\nis not an easy cargo to clean. Immediately after discharge do the mandatory<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">prewash. Long hot wash\nwith very hot water is required. Use coal tar cleaner. Use Metal brite for<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">pipeline steaming.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Products which leave\nresidue (crude products) should never be cleaned by evaporation. The NVM\ncontent in the specification of a chemical is a good indicator as to whether a\nproduct will leave residue<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Chemicals with a low FP\nrequire the pre-cleaning temperature to be kept at least 10 C below FP to avoid\nflammable mixtures. If this is not possible, because the FP is lower than the\nambient temperature, all ignition sources must be eliminated.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Water soluble and water\nmiscible substances are easy to clean with water and the solubility of the\nsubstances might increase at higher temperatures. The use of a cleaning agent\nis only advisable for non-water soluble cargoes , to reduce the cleaning time\nor for odour removal . None of the veg oils are fats are soluble in water.\nMolasses is fully soluble in water.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://1.bp.blogspot.com/-7W4dVA8R9P4/U89ATohu3QI/AAAAAAAAt1U/xe8on8xByjk/s1600/phpccU4CL3b.png\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" src=\"http://1.bp.blogspot.com/-7W4dVA8R9P4/U89ATohu3QI/AAAAAAAAt1U/xe8on8xByjk/s1600/phpccU4CL3b.png\" height=\"118\" width=\"400\" /></a></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n</div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Certain cargoes like\nacetic acid, benzene, luboils, caustic soda, paraffin, molasses, phenol, DINP,\nfatty alcohols, HMD , Hitec, WPAC, butyl acrylate , creosote etc can be hot\npre-washed.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://3.bp.blogspot.com/-GGOsQCtRSRQ/U80tB1nBUMI/AAAAAAAAt1E/IFs3Sez3QGE/s1600/VADAKAYIL3.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" src=\"http://3.bp.blogspot.com/-GGOsQCtRSRQ/U80tB1nBUMI/AAAAAAAAt1E/IFs3Sez3QGE/s1600/VADAKAYIL3.jpg\" height=\"176\" width=\"200\" /></a></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">-------CAPT AJIT\nVADAKAYIL<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">( 30 YEARS IN COMMAND )&nbsp;</span></div>\n</div>\n", "author": {"id": "14410812789424637654", "displayName": "Capt. There, the\nLord gave him a manuscript containing 100 verses which described the many\nfacets of the Goddess, as a gift to him. &nbsp;While Shankara was returning after visiting\nKailash, Nandi stopped him on the way. He snatched the manuscript from him,\ntore it into two, took one part and gave the other to Shankara. &nbsp;&nbsp;Shankara, desolate, ran to Shiva and narrated\nthe incident to him. Shiva, smiling, commanded him to retain the 41 verses with\nhim as the initial part of the 100 verses and then, write an extra 59 verses in\npraise of the Goddess himself: UNQUOTE<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">The first 41 verses are\ncalled Ananda Lahari -waves of bliss , revealed by Shiva himself to Adi\nShankaracharya at Mount Kailash .</span><span style=\"font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp; </span><span style=\"font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">These\nverses describe mystical union of Lord Shiva and his consort Shakti touching\nupon tantra,</span><span style=\"font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; line-height: 150%;\">Adi Shankaracharya was\nclosely associated with the Kedarnath Temple.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: large;\"><b>KUDAJADRI MOUNTAIN,\nCHITRAMOOLA CAVE, ADI SHANKARACHARYA 2000 BC VADAKAYIL<o:p></o:p></b></span></span></div>\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue;\"><br /></span></span>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">SLOKA NO. 38:-<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: purple;\">\"Samunmeelathsamvithkamalamakarandaikarasikam<o:p></o:p></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: purple;\">Bhajey Hamsadvandvam\nKimapi Mahathaam Maanasacharam!<o:p></o:p></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: purple;\">Yadaalaapaadashtaadashagunithavidyaaparinathihi<o:p></o:p></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: purple;\">Yadaadaththey\nDoshaagunamakhilamadbhayaha Paya Iva!\"</span></i><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\"Oh Mother! I\nadore the pair of Swans (Shiva-Shakthi) who take delight in imbibing the honey\nof the full-blown lotus of knowledge of the anaahatha-chakra, and who swim in\nthe minds of the great. Their mutual conversation is what have become the\neighteen arts, and they separate good from evil, the way the swans separate the\nmilk from the water.\"<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The eighteen arts\nmentioned in Verse No. 38 are; &nbsp;The 4\nVedas, Siksha, Kalpam, Vyakaranam, Niruktam, Sandas, Jyotisham, Meemamsam,\nNyayam, Puranam, Dharma Shastram, Ayurvedam, Dhanurvedam, Gandarva Vedam and\nNeedi Shastram.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In the Tantric\ncosmology, the whole universe is perceived as being created, penetrated and\nsustained by two fundamental forces, which are permanently in a perfect,\nindestructible union. These forces or universal aspects are called Shiva and\nShakti. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>Shiva and Shakti are\none and the same.<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>There is no place that\nHe is not.<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>There is no place that\nShe is not.<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>They are one and the\nsame.<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>She is in every thing.<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>She is in every word.<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>She is all there is.<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>See Her in all things.<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>Hear Her in all sounds.<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>Know Her in all\nthoughts.<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>Feel Her in all\nfeelings.<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>She is all there is.<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>She is the one in the\nthree worlds.<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>Shiva and Shakti are\none and the same.<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>That is the secret.</i><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue;\"><br /></span></span>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Tantric art has\ncaptured the images of the Hindu god Shiva and his consort, the goddess Shakti,\nin ecstatic union. &nbsp;This is NOT perverted\nsex.&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Shiva is recognized as the\nembodiment of pure consciousness, and Shakti as the embodiment of pure\nenergy.&nbsp; Through uniting with Shiva,\nShakti gave form to his spirit and created the universe.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: Times New Roman, serif; font-size: small;\"><span style=\"line-height: 150%;\">SHIVA&nbsp;</span></span><span style=\"font-family: Times New Roman, serif;\"><span style=\"line-height: 24px;\">symbolizes</span></span><span style=\"font-family: Times New Roman, serif; font-size: small;\"><span style=\"line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;consciousness, the masculine principle. SHAKTI&nbsp;</span><span style=\"line-height: 24px;\">symbolizes</span><span style=\"line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;the feminine\nprinciple, the&nbsp;activating&nbsp;energy.</span></span><br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The cosmos in all its manifestations, as an\nact of love. The relationship between Shakti and Shiva is the dance of\nconsciousness and energy experienced within each of us, regardless of gender.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Shiva resides in the highest\nSahasr\u0101ra Chakra and Shakti in the lowest M\u016bl\u0101dh\u0101ra Chakra. When Prakriti and\nPurusha unite in the Sahasr\u0101ra Chakra ( raising of Kundalini ) , knowledge,\nknower and the object of knowledge become one. &nbsp;</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; line-height: 150%; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://2.bp.blogspot.com/-ptTCGlFSAqk/U72fz5VqH1I/AAAAAAAAtbM/g0IbnohepBg/s1600/shiva-sJGhakti.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" src=\"http://2.bp.blogspot.com/-ptTCGlFSAqk/U72fz5VqH1I/AAAAAAAAtbM/g0IbnohepBg/s1600/shiva-sJGhakti.jpg\" height=\"640\" width=\"450\" /></a></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Once we have experienced this no desires\nremain within us because we realise unequivocally that everything we have ever\nyearned for is carried within us. &nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In\nthis state of absolute consciousness there are no polarities and therefore no\nmore sorrows; there is only everlasting joy, unconditional love, unlimited\ncompassion and total understanding for all living beings.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><b>To understand what\nfollows , you must have perception\u2014or it will bounce off.</b><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Sankhya philosophy\nunified the Advaita and Dvaita forms of Hinduism in a most interesting\nmanner.&nbsp;&nbsp; Here when the insentient\nPrakriti ( female \u2013Dvaita ) comes in contact with the sentient Purusha (male\n\u2013Advaita ) , the universe evolves.&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Sankhya\nthus is a theory of evolution and understanding the universe. Prakriti cannot\nbe perceived, not because of its non-existence, but because of its subtlety. It\nis perceived in its effects.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In Sankhya, direct perception is the most\nimportant and fundamental source of all knowledge. When senses cannot directly\nperceive due to their limitations, inference is needed such as in philosophical\ndisputations. The very existence of Purusa ( BrahmAn \u2013 morphogenetic\nconsciousness ) is possible only through inference.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In evolution, Prakriti is\ntransformed and differentiated into multiplicity of objects. Evolution is\nfollowed by dissolution. In dissolution the physical existence, all the worldly\nobjects mingle back into Prakriti, which now remains as the undifferentiated,\nprimordial substance.&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Tantric system\nborrows the abstract dualism of Sankhya and modifies it into a personified\nmale\u2013female dualism. Prakriti functions by borrowing conscioussness from\nPurusha.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">As we evolve, the\nspirit will control the mind and body to determine our thoughts, words and\nactions. At the apex of evolution, the mind takes its cues from the spirit and\nthe body from the mind. Spirit is the principle of conscious life-- the vital\nprinciple in humans, animating the body or mediating between body and soul.&nbsp;</span><br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">There is no matter as such. Matter exists because of an intelligent force which\nholds the spiralling atoms . Energy when slowed down becomes coalesced matter\nwhich our 5 senses pick up.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The holographic mind is the matrix of all matter.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Shiva represents the\nconstitutive elements of the universe, while Shakti is the dynamic potency,\nwhich makes these elements come to life and act. The Samkhya philosophy\npromulgates a primordial cosmic duality. From the Tantric perspective, this\n\"scheme\" of creation is transformed, in the sense that the two cosmic\nprinciples are considered united, not separated.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Tantrism confers to Shiva and\nShakti the qualities of the feminine and masculine principles from the Samkhya\nphilosophy. The eternal and indestructible union between Shiva and Shakti gives\nbirth to the whole Macrocosm, in its stable, static aspect as well as in its\ndynamic one. Not only is Shakti responsible for creation, it is also the agent\nof all change<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">Verse 13 is missing\nfrom the Original manuscript. &nbsp;It is\ntotally FAKE.<o:p></o:p></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">In the Linga Purana\nwherein the immoral white invader injected poison \u2013Lord Shiva &nbsp;seduces the wives of the Maharishis in the\nDeodar Forest who come to give him alms . &nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">Bhikshatana ( Lord\nShiva naked ) roams around with a human skull as a begging bowl, and the\nMaharishis are very upset and have a confrontation with him.&nbsp; Why not? Their wives were sexually excited at\nthe mere sight of him. <o:p></o:p></span></i></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\"><br /></span></i></span>\n<span style=\"color: red; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">In the Mylapore temple\nfestival, the Bhikshatana icon is paraded in the streets along with four street\ndogs signifying the Vedas. &nbsp;Images of\nBhikshatana depict him clothed with tiger skin and other body ornaments, but\ndisplaying an erect phallus in Tamila Nadu and Orissa.&nbsp;</span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">SLOKA NO.15:-<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\"Sharathjyothsnaashubhraam\nShashiyuthajataajootamakutaam<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Varatthraasathraanasphatikaghatikaapusthakakaraa-m!<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Sakrunna Thvaa Nathvaa Kathamiva\nSathaam Sannidadhathe<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Madhuksheeradraakshaamadhurimadhureenaaha\nPhanithayaha!\"<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Literal Meaning:&nbsp; \"How can torrents of words, excelling\neven honey, milk and grapes, help flowing from the mouth of good men who once\nmake prostration to Thee who art endowed with the lustre of the autumnal moon,\nwho art holding Thy hands in the pose of granting boons and offering\nprotection, and sporting in the other two a rosary of crystal beads and a book,\nand who wearest the crescent moon in Thy crown of plaited locks!\"<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">SLOKA NO.16:-<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\"Kaveendraanaam\nChethahkamalavanabaalaathaparuchim<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Bhajanthe Ye Santhaha\nKathichidarunaameva Bhavatheem!<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Virinchipreyasyaastharunatharashrungaaralaharee<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Gabheeraabhirvaagbhirvidadhathi\nSathaam Ranjanamamee!\"<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Literal Meaning: \"O\nMother, Thou Aruna, the crimson-coloured Goddess, art like the light of\nmorning's rising sun to the lotus flowers constituted of the minds of gifted\npoets (helping as Thou dost, their poesy to blossom forth). Therefore, those\ndevoted men who adore Thee become capable of delighting the minds of assemblies\nof literary connoisseurs with the majestic flow of their words surging like\nwaves of erotic sentiments emanating from youthful Saraswathi; the Goddess of\nLearning.\"<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">SLOKA NO.17:-<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\"Savithribhirvaachaam\nShashimanishilaabhangaruchibhihi<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Vashinyaadyaabhisthvaam\nSaha Janani Sanchinthayanthi Yaha!<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Sa Karthaa Kaavyaanaam\nBhavathi Mahathaam Bhangiruchibhihi<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Vachobhirvaagdeveevadanakamalaamodamadhuraihi-!\"<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Literal Meaning: O\nMother! Those who meditate on Thee in association with Vashini and allied\ndeities- who are all the sources of speech and whose radiance resembles the\nlustre of freshly cut moonstone-can become the authors of poetical works as\ndelightful as those of great ones, and sweet with the fragrance of the mouth of\nSaraswathi, Goddess of poetry and learning.\"<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<i><span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Note:\nThese Eight Goddesses ( Vagdevis ) are back dated creations of the immoral white\ninvader --Vasini, Kameswari, Modini, Vimala, Aruna, Jayini, Sarveswari and\nKaulini.<o:p></o:p></span></i></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">SLOKA NO.18:-<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\"Thanuchchaayaabhisthe\nTharunatharanishreesaranibhihi<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Divam\nSarvaamurveemarunimanimagnaam Smarathi Yaha!<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Bhavanthyasya\nThrasyadvanaharinashaaleenanayanaaha<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Sahorvashyaa Vashyaaha\nKathi Kathi Na Geervaanaganikaahaa!\"<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Literal\nMeaning:\"How can numerous celestial courtesans including Urvashi, with\neyes bashful like those of a frightened deer of the forest, do not become\nfascinated by a person who meditates on the beauty of Thy form which bathes the\nheaven and the earth in its crimson radiance resembling the rising sun!\"<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<i><span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Note:\nThe FAKE Kalidasa ( back dated invention of the immoral white invader ) wrote\nthe FAKE play Vikram\u014drva\u015b\u012byam, ( fashioned after Shakespeare's Midsummer\nNight's Dream ) about the sexual affair between celestial nymph&nbsp; Urvashi and the married King Pururavas<o:p></o:p></span></i></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">SLOKA NO.19:-<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\"Mukham Bindum\nKrithvaa Kuchayugamadhasthasya Thadadho<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Haraardha Dhyaayedhyo\nHaramahishi They Manmathakalaam!<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Sa Sadyaha Sankshobham\nNayathi Vanitha Ithyathilaghu<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Thrilokeemapyaashu\nBhramayathi Raveendusthanayugaam!'<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Literal Meaning:\n\"Oh Consort of Hara! The one who thinks of a woman's face in the bindu (\nthe dot in the triangle), her twin breasts below it and the half of the letter\n\"H\" still below, and contemplates Thy manmathakala on those spots (\nand thus gets identified with her in meditation) will quickly stir the mind of\nany woman. This indeed is a trifle for him. For, in no time he can fascinate\neven the Thriloki ( the three worlds conceived as a woman) with the sun and\nmoon as breasts.\"<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue;\">- Making the face as\nthe central locus<o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue;\">- The pair of breasts<o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue;\">- Beneath that<o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue;\">- Beneath ( even) that<o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue;\">Tripura Sundari Temple\nis &nbsp;about 50 km from Agartala . During\nthe time of the white invader ( never before ) the stooge priest conducted animal\nscarifices ( like at the Kamakhya temple in Guwahati ) which is NOT sanctioned\nby Sanatana Dharma ..<o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue;\"><br /></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue;\">&nbsp;Goats were brought with garlands round their\nnecks, as offerings. &nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue;\"><br /></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue;\">A notice board there\nstill showsthe the charges for goat and buffalo sacrifices.
