line-height: 150%;\">And later Rothschild used our Lok Manya Bal\nGanghadara Tilak to write a book ARCTIC HOME OF THE VEDAS, where a respected\nIndian ( Chitpavan Jew \u2013nay\u2014Brahmin ) told Indians that the priceless Vedas is\nindeed written by the white man .<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Gita Govinda\nconsist of twelve chapter, further divided into twenty-four songs. Each song\nconsists of eight couplets, it is called Ashtapadi. Chapter one and chapter\ntwo, four five and twelve contain two ashtapadi each; chapters three, six,\neight, nine and ten contain only one ashtapadi each<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In the fourth song, of\nGita Govinda , the FAKE back dated Jaydeva the poet describes \u201c the delightful\ndance of love of Krishna with all gopis in the dark forest of Vrindavana. All\nthe gopis surround him, embracing him with joy and caress him passionately and\nhe praises them hugging one, kissing another passionately, glancing at another\nand smiling with other maiden in love\u201d.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Sri Jayadeva introduced\nthe cult of Radha and Krishna through his Gitagovinda .&nbsp;&nbsp; In Gitagovinda Krishna tells Radha that\nformerly she as Laxmi chose Him as her consort on the sea shore on the occasion\nof Samudra Manthana. &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Sri Chaitanya whom\nISKON propagates is Lord Krishna and the FAKE Radha , rolled into one.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">As a result of this\nincident Siva swallowed poison out of despair ( Oh fu#kin\u2019 yeah ? ). <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The immoral white man\nused Shaktism as a denomination of Hinduism to drive a GENDER wedge among\nShaivites and Vaishnavites. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue; font-size: large;\"><b>Let me make this very\nclear-- Both Shiva and Shakti are Consciousness--</b></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue; font-size: large;\"><b><br /></b></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue; font-size: large;\"><b>-- Shiva is the changeless\nstatic aspect of Consciousness, and Shakti is the kinetic, active aspect of the\nsame Consciousness.<o:p></o:p></b></span></span></div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://4.bp.blogspot.com/-Ppaxvs1FcSw/U8DNp0iiRdI/AAAAAAAAtfQ/0P7FAOS_0t0/s1600/hhh.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">Above: Shakti is manifested by\nShiva only during creation and is withdrawn into himself at the end of creation</span></i><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Modern science repeats\nfrom our Vedas that matter and energy are interchangeable. &nbsp;So does consciousness and energy .&nbsp; In the highest planes they are\ninterchangeable, which is why we see a great incongruence between our spiritual\nexperiences and the external reality. In the higher metaphysical realms and\nsubtle planes of our consciousness the physical laws of our universe lose their\nvalidity.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>Tayor yad yamalam rupam\nsa samghatta iti smrtah---<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>Ananda-saktih saivokta\nyato visvam visrjyati,<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>Na Sivah Saktirahito na\nSaktih Sivavar</i>jita.&nbsp;\n---(<b>Tantraloka-Ahnika, 3</b>.)<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\"The coupled form\nof these two (Shiva-Shakti) is called junction. &nbsp;That is called the blissful Shakti from which\ncreation arises. There is no Shiva without Shakti, nor Shakti without Shiva.\"<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The vulgar white historain\nwrites : QUOTE<span style=\"color: blue;\"> \u201c As set out in the first line of Adi Shankara's renowned Shakta\nhymn, Saundaryalahari (c. 800 CE): \"If Shiva is united with Shakti, he is\nable to create. If he is not, he is incapable even of stirring.\" This is\nthe fundamental tenet of Shaktism, as emphasized in the widely known image of\nthe goddess Kali striding atop the seemingly lifeless body of Shiva Sri\nJayadeva filled up this critical void beautifully by composing the Gitagovinda which\nnot only became the Bible for the later Vaishnavites but also had profound\ninfluence on music, dance and drama in the whole country. The recognition and\nrespect for female sexuality and womanpower representing Maya and Shakti which\nare integral parts of the Supreme Lord, got established in Literature and\nreligion after Gitagovinda</span>.\u201d QUOTE <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">QUOTE Ardhanarishwara - often\nreferred to as a hermaphrodite or androgynous deity, is one of the principal\nforms of Shiva. &nbsp;Homosexuals,\nhermaphrodites and transvestites can be considered sacred beings -\n\"images\" of Ardhanarishwara.UNQUOTE<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">QUOTE : Brahma created the\ngoddess Gauri to be the wife of Rudra. Rudra was initially pleased by this, but\nwhen Brahma asked him to beget progeny, he submerged himself in the waters and\nperformed austerities for thousands of years. When at last, Rudra emerged, he\ncastrated himself, and set his linga ('sign') free. It became a fiery pillar -\na sign of cosmic potential. By his action of self-castration, he reveals the\nsign - the nature - of the Manifest Universe, in relation to that which is\nUnmanifested. &nbsp;:UNQUOTE<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; color: blue; font-family: Times New Roman, serif; font-size: large;\"><b><span style=\"line-height: 150%;\">Hey, &nbsp;how&nbsp;</span><span style=\"line-height: 24px;\">many</span><span style=\"line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;of you want to castrate yourselves and set your pricks free ?</span></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">QUOTE : In Kali's Child: The\nMystical and the Erotic in the Life and Teachings of Ramakrishna, author\nJeffrey J. Kripal discusses Ramakrishna's injunction that, in order to approach\na God, the male devotee should take on a female identity. Ramakrishna paired\nhis male disciples up into 'masculine' and 'feminine' couples. Ramakrishna\nspent long periods in a 'handmaid state' . &nbsp;Mathur would buy Ramakrishna women's clothes,\nshawls and jewelry for him, and dress Ramakrishna with his own hands. <span style=\"color: blue;\">The saint\nis reputed to have experienced a vision of Radha immediately after Mathur gave\nRamakrishna some feminine garments to wear. </span>Ramakrishna often imitated the\nmannerisms of women, in order to \"conquer lust.\" The logic, as Kripal\nexplains it, is that since sexual desire can only exist between man and woman,\nthen if a man can 'become' a woman, his 'desire' for women will disappear.\nHowever, Kripal reveals the secret of Ramakrishna in that: \"As a woman,\nRamakrishna was ascetic to women and erotic to men\" (p234). Kripal goes on\nto say that '<span style=\"color: blue;\">becoming a woman' for Ramakrishna, inflamed his desire for men,</span>\nand male deities. <span style=\"color: blue;\">Whilst 'being' a woman, Ramakrishna sang to his boy\ndisciples, nursed them at his breasts, and fondled them in his lap. </span>Kripal\nrecounts that, when asked by a disciple whether he was a man or a woman, the\nsaint replied with a smile, \"I don't know.\" :UNQUOTE<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue;\">Note: Ramakrishna is\nthe Guru of Swami Vivekananda.</span><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div>\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: Times New Roman, serif;\">Getting back-</span></div>\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: Times New Roman, serif;\"><br /></span>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Verse: 14<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Mangal&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u0915\u094d\u0937\u093f\u0924\u094c</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;Mangal&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u0937\u091f\u094d\u092a\u091e\u094d\u091a\u093e\u0936\u0926\u094d\u0926\u094d\u0935\u093f\u0938\u092e\u0927\u093f\u0915\u092a\u091e\u094d\u091a\u093e\u0936\u0926\u0941\u0926\u0915\u0947</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; udaka \u2013 water;\nhut\u0101\u015ba \u2013 fire; dv\u0101 \u1e63a\u1e63\u1e6dika \u2013 two and sixty (sixty two); catur adhika pa\u00f1c\u0101\u015bad \u2013\n(four above fifty) fifty four; anile \u2013 air; divi \u2013 ether or \u0101k\u0101\u015ba; dvi\u1e25\u1e63a\u1e6d tri\u1e41\u015ba\n\u2013 seventy two; manasi \u2013 mind; ca \u2013 and; catu\u1e25 \u1e63a\u1e63\u1e6dir \u2013 sixty four; iti \u2013 thus;\nye may\u016bkha -&nbsp; luster of light; te\u1e63\u0101m api\n\u2013 the rays of light; upari \u2013 above or upwards; tava \u2013 Your; p\u0101da ambuja yugam \u2013\npair of lotus feet (ambuja \u2013 lotus).<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; line-height: 150%;\">Fifty four rays of p\u1e5bthivi\ntattva, &nbsp;fifty six rays of water tattva, &nbsp;sixty two rays of fire tattva, &nbsp;fifty four rays of air tattva, &nbsp;seventy rays of akasa (ether) tattva, &nbsp;sixty four rays of mind tattva, &nbsp;all originate from Your lotus feet in the\nmiddle of sahasrara.\u201d<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">This verse is based on\npsychic chakras of ku\u1e47\u1e0dalini meditation. &nbsp;Each of the tattvas mentioned in this verse is\ndirectly related to chakras of ku\u1e47\u1e0dalini meditation. &nbsp;&nbsp;Tattva means principle.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue;\">\u0101j\u00f1\u0101 \u2013 forehead<o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n</td>\n  <td style=\"border-bottom: solid windowtext 1.0pt; border-left: none; border-right: solid windowtext 1.0pt; border-top: none; padding: 0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt;\" valign=\"top\"><div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%; margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin-bottom: 0in;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue;\">&nbsp;64<o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n</td>\n </tr>\n<tr>\n  <td style=\"border-top: none; border: solid windowtext 1.0pt; mso-border-top-alt: solid windowtext 1.0pt; padding: 0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt;\" valign=\"top\"><div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%; margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin-bottom: 0in;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue;\">TOTAL RAYS<o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n</td>\n  <td style=\"border-bottom: solid windowtext 1.0pt; border-left: none; border-right: solid windowtext 1.0pt; border-top: none; padding: 0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt;\" valign=\"top\"></td>\n  <td style=\"border-bottom: solid windowtext 1.0pt; border-left: none; border-right: solid windowtext 1.0pt; border-top: none; padding: 0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt;\" valign=\"top\"><div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%; margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin-bottom: 0in;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue;\">360<o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n</td>\n </tr>\n</tbody></table>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%; margin-bottom: 0in;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">When Shakti merges with\nShiva she radiates myriad rays, 360 of which illumine the world in the form of\nFire, Sun and Moon. Agni = 118; Sun = 106; Moon = 136. &nbsp; They light up the macro-\nand microcosm. 360 rays make a year and KAla (Time). Shiva is partless; he has\nno Kalas.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">This manifest\nuniverse,&nbsp; is created by the 360 rays of\nKalasakti. The 360 refers to the 360 days of the solar year. From the Samaya,\nwhich resides in the transcendent Sahasrara (also candrakalackara) there pours\nforth innumerable rays.&nbsp;&nbsp; Sun, Moon and\nFire \u201ccollect\u201d 360 of these rays, from which is created the manifest world and\nthe human body. These rays fall into three divisions mentioned above \u2013 Agneyakhanda\n(108) Saurakhanda (116) and Somakhanda (136).<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The psychic centres are\ngrouped under three khanda-s and they are surya khanda, chandra (or soma) khanda\nand agni khanda.&nbsp; &nbsp;The two psychic centres muladhara and svadhisthana\ncome under agni khanda; manipura and anahata come under surya khanda; vishuddhi\nand ajna come under chandra khanda.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Each of these khandas are controlled by a\nknot known as granthi. &nbsp;&nbsp;Muladhara and svadhisthana\ncome under Brahma granthi; &nbsp;ma\u1e47ipura and\nanahata come under Vishnu granthi and vishuddhi and ajna come under Rudra\ngranthi. &nbsp;Agni, surya and chandra are\nplaced just above these granthis and redistribute the rays to the two chakras\nunder them. &nbsp;Unless these granthias are\npierced, one cannot reach sahasrara.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The three great lights\n\u2013 Sun, Moon and Fire \u2013 \u201ccollect\u201d 360 of these rays, out of which emanates the\nentire universe. &nbsp;These 360 rays are\ntermed Kalas. &nbsp;&nbsp;108 kalas to (Fire), 116 to Saurakhanda (Sun)\nand 136 to Somakhanda (Moon). &nbsp;These\nkalas correspond to the 6 chakras . The tattvas \u2013 Maya, Suddhavidya, Mahesvara,\nSadasiva and Samaya are transcendent to the 360 kalas.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Tattva is a Sanskrit\nand Malayalam word meaning&nbsp; 'principle',\n'reality' .<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">There are two types of\nyears; one is based on the sun and the other is based on the moon. The calendar\nbased on the sun is called solar year and consists of 365.25 days and the\ncalendar based on moon consists of 354.37 days. Solar calendar is based on the\nmovement of sun through the twelve zodiacal signs.&nbsp; Sun takes 365.25 days to traverse through all\nthe twelve zodiac signs and the moon takes only 354.37 days to traverse through\nall the twelve zodiacs.&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Each day of the\nlunar calendar forms one kal\u0101 of the moon and therefore the total kal\u0101-s of a\nlunar year is 354.37. 360 is arrived at by adding 354.37 + 365.25 / 2 = 359.81\ndays and rounded off to 360. Each of these 360 days is represented by a kal\u0101 of\nthe moon. These 360 rays are spread to six psychic centres. The six psychic\ncentres are categorised into three groups known as kha\u1e47\u1e0da-s and each kha\u1e47\u1e0da is\npresided by sun, moon and fire.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Tattvas are generally\nassociated with external worship. Internal worship is worshipping Her in Her\nsubtlest ku\u1e47\u1e0dalin\u012b form. Whether worship is done externally or internally, 360\nrays are arrived at.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">These rays are not just\nrays, but they represent a tattva in external worship and the petals of each\nchakra in mental worship. These rays are also mediated in the form of m\u0101t\u1e5bka-s\n(alphabets of Sanskrit) in these chakras.&nbsp;\nTo sum up, 360 rays originate from Her lotus feet in sahasr\u0101ra that get\nreflected through three kha\u1e47\u1e0da-s, fire, sun and the moon. Rays do not mean just\nthe light, but also the cosmic energy. Without the cosmic energy that is being\nsent to these chakras, existence itself is not possible.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Both sun and moon or ida and pingala unite with fire or susumna.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">These luminaries are\nsituated just above the granthi-s, also known as knots. Unless these knots are\npierced, the origin of these rays, Her feet cannot be realized. &nbsp;This is with\nreference to internal worship, also known as chakra meditation. &nbsp;Externally,\nworship happens in Sri Yantra. When Her radiating feet are seen, one is\nliberated.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Prana circulates\nthroughout all of our nadis and vital canals. All of the 72,000 nadis of our\norganism have their fundamental base on the nadi Kanda. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The nadi Kanda is\nsituated between the sexual organs and the anus. The Kanda collects all of the\nsexual energy that circulates throughout the 72,000 canals of our organism. The\nsexual energy is Prana, life. It is like the shape of an egg and is covered\nwith membranes. This is just above the Muladhara Chakra.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">All the Nadis of the\nbody spring from this Kanda. It is in the junction where Sushumna is connected\nwith Muladhara Chakra. The four petals of the Muladhara Chakra are on the sides\nof this Kanda and the junction is called Granthi-Sthana, where the influence of\nMaya is very strong. Kanda is a centre of the astral body from where Yoga\nNadis, subtle channels, spring and carry the Sukshma Prana (vital energy) to\nthe different parts of the body.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The spinal cord extending from the brain to\nthe end of the vertebral column tapers off. Before its termination it gives off\ninnumerable fibres, crowded into a bunch of nerves. This bunch of nerves is\n\u2018Cauda equina\u2019 in the gross body. The astral centre of \u2018Cauda equina\u2019 is\nKanda.\"&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The cauda equina &nbsp;is a\nbundle of spinal nerves and spinal nerve roots, consisting of the second\nthrough fifth lumbar nerve pairs, the first through fifth sacral nerve pairs,\nand the coccygeal nerve, all of which originate in the conus medullaris of the\nspinal cord. The nerves that compose the cauda equina innervate the pelvic\norgans and lower limbs to include motor innervation of the hips, knees, ankles,\nfeet, internal anal sphincter and external anal sphincter. In addition, the\ncauda equina extends to sensory innervation of the perineum and, partially,\nparasympathetic innervation of the bladder.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The left-side channel\nis called the ida. It's qualities are cool, soft, reflective, and sensitive\nlike the moon. The right-side channel is called the pingala and is associated\nwith heat, activity and strength, like the sun. The balance of energy flow on\nthese two sides affects the sensations of heat and cold in the physical body.\nThese two channels originate in the sushumna, near the base of the spine (in an\nenergy vortex, or bulb called a kanda), and they correspond to the first\nchakra, muladhara. They spiral up the sushumna, crisscrossing at each of the\nsix higher chakras.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<object class=\"BLOGGER-youtube-video\" classid=\"clsid:D27CDB6E-AE6D-11cf-96B8-444553540000\" codebase=\"http://download.macromedia.com/pub/shockwave/cabs/flash/swflash.cab#version=6,0,40,0\" data-thumbnail-src=\"https://ytimg.googleusercontent.com/vi/IcvkQloIc_g/0.jpg\" height=\"266\" width=\"320\"><param name=\"movie\" value=\"https://youtube.googleapis.com/v/IcvkQloIc_g&source=uds\" /><param name=\"bgcolor\" value=\"#FFFFFF\" /><param name=\"allowFullScreen\" value=\"true\" /><embed width=\"320\" height=\"266\"  src=\"https://youtube.googleapis.com/v/IcvkQloIc_g&source=uds\" type=\"application/x-shockwave-flash\" allowfullscreen=\"true\"></embed></object></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The ida nadi, or\n\"channel of comfort,\" represents the feminine and lunar aspects of\nthe body. It begins on the left side of the kanda and terminates at the left\nnostril. The pinglala nadi, also known as the \"tawny current,\"\noriginates on the right side of the kanda. It is associated with the male,\nsolar aspects of the body, and terminates at the right nostril.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Kanda called\n\"tuber\", \"tuber\". &nbsp;The\nKanda is an egg shaped energy center in the pelvic area. Inside, he is golden,\ncovered externally by a white membrane. Its lower end is the man in the\nperineum between the scrotum and anus, with the woman in the rear lower part of\nthe vagina. &nbsp;The lower end is also\nreferred to as \"Kanda-point.\" &nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">There\nare numerous Hatha Yoga exercises to stimulate this Kanda-point or activate it.\nThe ovoid Kanda passes through the prostate or the uterus up to the point\nbetween the umbilicus and the spine. It projects so into the field of solar\nenergy. It is important to feel the Kanda, to relax, to activate and to be\ncentered in Kanda, before you start with advanced energy practices.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Shakti, the static\nunmanifested Kundalini, is symbolized by a serpent coiled into three and a half\ncircles around the central axis Svayambhu-linga at the base of the spine. The\nserpent lies blocking the entrance to Sushumna, the central channel with his\nmouth. Sushumna remains closed at its lower end as long as Kundalini is not\nawakened.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The technique of Kundalini Yoga consists in using Prana (the vital\nair), guiding its circulatory movement through Ida and Pingala down to the base\nof the spine into the space where Kundalini lies coiled. The vital energies of\nthe opposite forces circulating in Ida and Pingala will be unified and Shakti\nKundalini will then awaken and rise up Sushumna, energizing the seven chakras.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://2.bp.blogspot.com/-7EBEBuCRWyw/U8I622RiVwI/AAAAAAAAthM/ITatJJeD-Dk/s1600/dowfrenload.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" src=\"http://2.bp.blogspot.com/-7EBEBuCRWyw/U8I622RiVwI/AAAAAAAAthM/ITatJJeD-Dk/s1600/dowfrenload.jpg\" height=\"400\" width=\"364\" /></a></div>\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The end of\nKundalini-Yoga is beyond all heaven worlds. No Yogi seeks \u201cHeaven\u201d but union\nwith that which is the source of all worlds.&nbsp;\nThe object and aim of Sat-Cakra-bheda is Yoga, the union with the\nSupreme Self or Paramatma..&nbsp;</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://4.bp.blogspot.com/-VZEEFjO9fz4/U8FyMahokQI/AAAAAAAAtgg/WJsMyevPuMc/s1600/downlddeoad.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Piercing the Brahma Granthi or Knot sometimes\ninvolves considerable pain.&nbsp;</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://3.bp.blogspot.com/-5xvx_rqxKzc/U8FydROgsyI/AAAAAAAAtgo/DmrPc27HgRk/s1600/dofgwnload.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" src=\"http://3.bp.blogspot.com/-5xvx_rqxKzc/U8FydROgsyI/AAAAAAAAtgo/DmrPc27HgRk/s1600/dofgwnload.jpg\" height=\"257\" width=\"400\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">When the Sakti (Power) has reached the upper brain\n(Sahasrara] the whole body is cold and corpselike; except the top of the skull,\nwhere some warmth is felt, this being the place where the static and kinetic\naspects of Consciousness unite.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%; margin-bottom: 0in;\">\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Shakti awakens, goes up\nsushumna nadi and unites with Shiva in sahasrara chakra. Shiva represents the\nhigher cosmic consciousness and Shakti represents evolution of energy.\nKundalini yoga is based on this concept.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%; margin-bottom: 0in;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://4.bp.blogspot.com/-aCxBt8nHt_U/U8F0UkLTIcI/AAAAAAAAtg8/6GRD_-rKmd0/s1600/imagesCAOKJPBK.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%; mso-fareast-font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Punch into Google\nsearch-<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue; font-size: large;\"><b>AWAKENING AND RAISING\nKUNDALINI AFTER 21ST DEC 2012 VADAKAYIL</b></span><span style=\"font-size: small;\"><o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: Times New Roman, serif;\">and</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: purple; font-size: large;\"><b>CHAKRA VORTEX , SCALAR\nENERGY TRANSCEIVER VADAKAYIL</b></span><span style=\"font-size: small;\"><o:p></o:p></span></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: purple; font-size: large;\"><b><br /></b></span></span></div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; line-height: 150%; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://2.bp.blogspot.com/-uHbfdJvbzWw/U8Fz2m62M3I/AAAAAAAAtg0/MTPcVnLpS8A/s1600/imffgages.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" src=\"http://2.bp.blogspot.com/-uHbfdJvbzWw/U8Fz2m62M3I/AAAAAAAAtg0/MTPcVnLpS8A/s1600/imffgages.jpg\" height=\"400\" width=\"400\" /></a></div>\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">I het the sneaky feelin\u2019\nthat my readers are getting bored.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">So let me give them a\nwakeup call.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In Kalari, there are\n108 marmas.&nbsp; When I talk about Jaladhara\nBandha , I will talk more .<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Meanwhile just see what\na small pressure on a Kalari marma can do to you.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; line-height: 150%; text-align: center;\">\n<object class=\"BLOGGER-youtube-video\" classid=\"clsid:D27CDB6E-AE6D-11cf-96B8-444553540000\" codebase=\"http://download.macromedia.com/pub/shockwave/cabs/flash/swflash.cab#version=6,0,40,0\" data-thumbnail-src=\"https://ytimg.googleusercontent.com/vi/Ow2MpwYq1nY/0.jpg\" height=\"266\" width=\"320\"><param name=\"movie\" value=\"https://youtube.googleapis.com/v/Ow2MpwYq1nY&source=uds\" /><param name=\"bgcolor\" value=\"#FFFFFF\" /><param name=\"allowFullScreen\" value=\"true\" /><embed width=\"320\" height=\"266\"  src=\"https://youtube.googleapis.com/v/Ow2MpwYq1nY&source=uds\" type=\"application/x-shockwave-flash\" allowfullscreen=\"true\"></embed></object></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">What is Kalari?<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Punch into Google\nsearch-<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue; font-size: large;\"><b>KALARIPAYATTU , THE\nOLDEST AND THE DEADLIEST MARTIAL ART VADAKAYIL</b></span><span style=\"font-size: small;\"><o:p></o:p></span></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue; font-size: large;\"><b><br /></b></span></span></div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; line-height: 150%; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://2.bp.blogspot.com/-Bm3JQGaxSAU/U8Jo05QMaII/AAAAAAAAtic/WCEObWO1wbg/s1600/chakra-poster-hhnewest31.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" src=\"http://2.bp.blogspot.com/-Bm3JQGaxSAU/U8Jo05QMaII/AAAAAAAAtic/WCEObWO1wbg/s1600/chakra-poster-hhnewest31.jpg\" height=\"640\" width=\"502\" /></a></div>\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Time to let out a few ancient\nsecrets-<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In tantra there are 3 PSYCHIC\nknots to be untied that block the path of Shakti . &nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Only after untying\nthese 3 knots , it is possible to transcend the genetic code to complete\nfreedom where individual ego dissolves and &nbsp;the will of the Divine prevails. There is NO homosexuality\nor perverted sex here.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The three granthis\nrestrict human life to instinctive, emotional and intellectual levels.\nSpiritual life lies beyond these three levels.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The ida and the pingala\ngo up spirally, alternating from left to right and from right to left, forming\na loop around each chakra. &nbsp;They\noriginate from the common center of muladhara at the base of the spine, but at\nthe top their ends are free. &nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">However,\nthere are three points called granthis or knots where they seem to anastamose\nor conjoin. &nbsp;These knots, which act as\nbarriers to the free flow of prana, represent three levels of psychophysical\nlife.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<b><span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Brahma\nGranthi</span></b><span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"> :- Brahma Granthi is the knot of Brahma at the\npelvis or Mooladhara chakra.&nbsp; Brahma\nGranthi is related to the physical body, to the world of names and forms.&nbsp; It obstructs Kundalini's path ( for Shakti to\nmerge with Shiva) as she begins to move toward the higher centers. &nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Till one unties this knot ambitions and\ndesires lay siege. It is NOT possible to do proper meditation as the mind\nremaind unfocussed . This world of names and forms enters us through five sense\norgans eyes, ears, nose, tongue, and skin. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<b><span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Vishnu\nGranthi:&nbsp; </span></b><span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Vishnu\nGranthi is the knot of Vishnu at the heart or Anahata chakra.&nbsp; It is &nbsp;related to the astral body and to the world of\nemotions. Untying this knot breaks free the desire to preserve our identity,\nwhich includes society, family, and friends.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<b><span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Rudra\nGranthi</span></b><span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">: Rudra Granthi is the knot of Shiva at the space\nbetween the eyebrows , the third eye of Shiva --or Ajna Chakra. &nbsp;It is &nbsp;related to the causal body and to the\nworld&nbsp; of thought, ideas, visions, and\nintuitions.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">When Kundalini ascends Vishuddha Chakra and reaches Ajna Chakra,\nand beyond the five elements of earth, water, fire, air, and akasha. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">When the Rudra granthi\nis untied, we are liberated from the physical world becoming tattvatitas. &nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Bhagavad-gita (13.22)\naffirms:<i><o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>purusah prakrti-stho hi<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>bhunkte prakrti-jan\ngunan<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>karanam guna-sango 'sya<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>sad-asad-yoni-janmasu</i><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\"The living entity\nin material nature thus follows the ways of life, enjoying the three modes of\nnature. This is due to his association with that material nature. Thus he meets\nwith good and evil among various species.\u201d<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Sankhya was introduced\nby Maharishi Kapil to his disciple Asuri and his old mother Devhooti for\nliberation just before her death.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Tattva is a Sanskrit\nand Malayalam word meaning&nbsp; 'principle',\n'reality' . <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://3.bp.blogspot.com/-OtfL0pWl_14/U8JojbOzqNI/AAAAAAAAtiU/mWU2Hj-ViVY/s1600/you_areuu_not_blog.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" src=\"http://3.bp.blogspot.com/-OtfL0pWl_14/U8JojbOzqNI/AAAAAAAAtiU/mWU2Hj-ViVY/s1600/you_areuu_not_blog.jpg\" height=\"400\" width=\"252\" /></a></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Sankhya-Yoga system\ndivides all knowable phenomena into 25 Tattvas.</span><span style=\"font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">25. Purusha \u2013 the\nsentient being (consciousness), the experiencer<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">24. Prakriti \u2013 primal\nnature (root of all insentient matter)<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Antahkaranas \u2013 internal\norgans<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">23. Mahat-Buddhi \u2013\nintelligence<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">22. Ahamkara \u2013\nobjective ego<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">21. Manas \u2013 mind<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;Jnanendriyas Sense-organs, for receiving the\nbhutas and the tanmatras, viz<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">20&nbsp; karna (the auditory sense)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">19&nbsp; tvak (the thermal sense)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">18&nbsp; chaksu (the visual sense)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">17&nbsp; rasana (the gustatory sense)&nbsp;&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">16&nbsp; nasa (the olfactory sense)<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Karmaendriyas organs of\naction, viz.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">15 vak (vocal\norgan)&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">14 pani (manual\norgan)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">13 pada (organ of\nlocomotion)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">12 payu (excretory\norgan)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">11 upastha (genital\norgan)<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Tanmatras \u2013 subtle\nelements<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">10. Shabda \u2013 sound<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">9. Sparsha \u2013 feel<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">8. Rupa \u2013 form<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">7. Rasa \u2013 taste<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">6. Gandha \u2013 smell<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Mahabhutas \u2013 gross\nelements<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">5. Akasha \u2013 space<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">4. Vayu \u2013 air<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">3. Tejas \u2013 fire<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">2. Ap \u2013 water<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">1. Prithivi \u2013 earth<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The tattvas are\nguideposts to orient ourselves within the map and to see what we experience as\nseparate concepts are truly part of a larger whole. .&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; line-height: 150%; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://1.bp.blogspot.com/-NfVVy1mnDLo/U8JpIYnd53I/AAAAAAAAtik/BM7r2xc39nk/s1600/iStock_000016507nbn590XSmall.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" src=\"http://1.bp.blogspot.com/-NfVVy1mnDLo/U8JpIYnd53I/AAAAAAAAtik/BM7r2xc39nk/s1600/iStock_000016507nbn590XSmall.jpg\" height=\"406\" width=\"640\" /></a></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Samkhya as you can see\nwas a masterpiece of modeling the ways of the inner universe.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In accordance with the\nSamkhya tradition, tattvas are seen as building blocks that evolve from the\npure potential of prakriti\u2019s first creative impulse, or first tattva, to 25\nsuccessive templates of form (tattvas) that comprise all worldly\nexistence.&nbsp; .&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; line-height: 150%; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://4.bp.blogspot.com/-FSLiCFWn_WI/U8Jp7ROgcWI/AAAAAAAAtiw/IZKAPEE3zzY/s1600/images.jpgkgl.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" src=\"http://4.bp.blogspot.com/-FSLiCFWn_WI/U8Jp7ROgcWI/AAAAAAAAtiw/IZKAPEE3zzY/s1600/images.jpgkgl.jpg\" height=\"160\" width=\"400\" /></a></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">When the tattvas collapse\nback into the very elements which gave rise to our creation, they merge with\nour primordial nature in the Mahat tattva, located at the Ajna chakra. &nbsp;&nbsp;The Ida and Pingala nadis also unify at this\nchakra into the sushumna nadi, which releases the tattvatita from the shackles\nof space and time.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">After crossing the\nfifth chakra Kundalini moves to the sixth, where the tattvas merge into their\nsource, Maha Tattva. Here the Ida and Pingala nadis cross over each other and\ndisintegrate in the left and right nostrils, respectively. As lunar and solar\nchannels, Ida and Pingala are time bound.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; line-height: 150%; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://1.bp.blogspot.com/-kPmkEFcIK6Y/U8JqE9SnoFI/AAAAAAAAti4/WNA5OD-FAuM/s1600/micrbgos.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" src=\"http://1.bp.blogspot.com/-kPmkEFcIK6Y/U8JqE9SnoFI/AAAAAAAAti4/WNA5OD-FAuM/s1600/micrbgos.jpg\" /></a></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">After this plexis in Ajna Chakra, the\ntime bound consciousness dissolves, and one establishes himself in Infinity.\nThis knot then unties itself, and is able to ascend with it's moving energy\ninto the Soma Chakra.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">When the Kundalini\nShakti breaks free of the Rudra granthi knot, it is able to pierce the Sahasrara\nchakra and rise the aspirant\u2019s consciousness to an infinite dimension.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The methods of Yoga\nSastra are based on Yoga Darsana of Patanjali, according to which binding\n(bandha) of individual soul (jiva) is because of mistaking intellect (buddhi)\nfor self (atma). However self is beyond all upadhis \u2013 body (sareera), senses\n(indryia), mind (manas), intellect (buddhi), memory (citta) and ego\n(ahankara).&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; line-height: 150%; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://2.bp.blogspot.com/-oGTg2t0GQ6w/U8Jn-NCDb7I/AAAAAAAAtiM/FmyELPfJOBo/s1600/chakrahus300.gif\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" src=\"http://2.bp.blogspot.com/-oGTg2t0GQ6w/U8Jn-NCDb7I/AAAAAAAAtiM/FmyELPfJOBo/s1600/chakrahus300.gif\" height=\"640\" width=\"448\" /></a></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">And it cannot be reached\nthrough any of these.&nbsp; Only in unalloyed\nself-conscious state can the being be united with the cosmic Being.&nbsp; The only way is to dissolve the physical and\nmental consciousness in consciousness of self. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Yoga defines Samadhi,\nthe state where the seeker, sought and the process of seeking merge into one\nsingle continuum and no separation remains between them.&nbsp; When applied to worship, this translates as\n\u201cthe state where there is no difference between the devotee, God and worship\u201d.\nas \u201cthe state in which mind dissolves in self-consciousness, the being experiences\nhimself as the unalloyed self, and clearly distinguishes self from other\nfaculties of consciousness\u201d.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">According to Mandukya\nUpanishad, the gross (sthula), subtle (sukshma), causal (karana) and absolute\n(turiya) are the four states in which Brahman manifests<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">There is one granthi\nper two chakras. The bottom two \u2013 muladhara and swadhisthana associate with one\ngranthi, the Brahma granthi.&nbsp; This will\nbe Agni mandala.&nbsp; This is where\nkundalini, the Mother starts moving upwards \u2013 and this is the reason she is\ncalled Agni kunda samudbhava or Agni Sikha or Agni mandala vasini.&nbsp; This will be the beginning of the sadhaka\u2019s\nspiritual life.&nbsp;&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; line-height: 150%; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://1.bp.blogspot.com/-HrzaEr_XbJ0/U8JrmH9ihjI/AAAAAAAAtjg/sJ90RFyLXQQ/s1600/dogaaaaawnload.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" src=\"http://1.bp.blogspot.com/-HrzaEr_XbJ0/U8JrmH9ihjI/AAAAAAAAtjg/sJ90RFyLXQQ/s1600/dogaaaaawnload.jpg\" height=\"301\" width=\"400\" /></a></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; line-height: 150%; text-align: center;\">\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Manipura and anahata\nassociate with Vishnu granthi. This will be Aditya/Surya mandala.&nbsp; Bulk of the sadhaka\u2019s spiritual life is spent\nhere, sustaining it.&nbsp;&nbsp; At Anahata one can\ntranscend the mind-life-matter triplet and reach the knowledge plane, and can\nsee the cosmic instead of individual. This is the place where he can hear the\ncosmic hiss too.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; line-height: 150%; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://2.bp.blogspot.com/-ORsJX22Kfro/U8JrTsFxmyI/AAAAAAAAtjY/ovUCOH7RT2M/s1600/Micro-Mhrdacro1.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" src=\"http://2.bp.blogspot.com/-ORsJX22Kfro/U8JrTsFxmyI/AAAAAAAAtjY/ovUCOH7RT2M/s1600/Micro-Mhrdacro1.jpg\" height=\"552\" width=\"640\" /></a></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Then visuddha and ajna\ncakras associate with Rudra granthi. This will be Soma mandala. This is the\nculmination of sadhana, and one achieves laya yoga here. The causal begins from\nhere. Visuddha is the center of jana loka, or the ananda maya kosa. This is the\nworld of existential bliss, or maaya.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; line-height: 150%; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://3.bp.blogspot.com/-3DjHUg7BchM/U8Jq16ftwiI/AAAAAAAAtjI/MvEK2goRHvE/s1600/532817_25106385hh1705157_1040351673_n.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" src=\"http://3.bp.blogspot.com/-3DjHUg7BchM/U8Jq16ftwiI/AAAAAAAAtjI/MvEK2goRHvE/s1600/532817_25106385hh1705157_1040351673_n.jpg\" height=\"480\" width=\"640\" /></a></div>\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; line-height: 150%; text-align: center;\">\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The union of Shakti\nwith Shiva is the liberation of seeker from the cycle of endless birth and\ndeath.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In yogic parlance , the\n3 granthis prevent the flow of prana into the main pranic passage of the body \u2013\nsushumna.&nbsp; &nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;;
