font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">White missionaries were\nordered to convert non-Christians, sometimes even if it required intimidation,\nforce or sops.&nbsp; &nbsp;They made the Hindus self loathing by\npropagating FAKE stories like how the queens made love to the phallus of a dead\nhorse in<b><span style=\"color: blue;\"> Ashwamedha sacrifice.</span></b> &nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">This is what Wikipedia\nhas to say -- ( you can check it yourself by Googling ASHVAMEDHA YAGNA\nWIKIPEDIA ).<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://1.bp.blogspot.com/-SnKEjDUk90E/U8YcwV-vp2I/AAAAAAAAtrI/YAhLM6SCUCE/s1600/300px-Asvamedhaty_ramayana.JPG\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" src=\"http://1.bp.blogspot.com/-SnKEjDUk90E/U8YcwV-vp2I/AAAAAAAAtrI/YAhLM6SCUCE/s1600/300px-Asvamedhaty_ramayana.JPG\" height=\"221\" width=\"400\" /></a></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; line-height: 150%;\">They have even given a\npicture of the Queen lying down with the dead horse ( to be used as dildo for\nsexual gratification ) -- this picture was painted by a Muslim painter Sahibdin.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">They say he painted it\nin 1652 AD , which is a lie. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://2.bp.blogspot.com/-yGzrcbOFXk0/U8YdDncrkGI/AAAAAAAAtrQ/qOtKzqeVbVw/s1600/The-Hindhuus.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" src=\"http://2.bp.blogspot.com/-yGzrcbOFXk0/U8YdDncrkGI/AAAAAAAAtrQ/qOtKzqeVbVw/s1600/The-Hindhuus.jpg\" height=\"400\" width=\"291\" /></a></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">QUOTE:--<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Anyone who should stop\nthe horse is ritually cursed, and a <span style=\"color: red;\">dog is killed</span> ..<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The queens walk around\nthe dead horse reciting mantras. The <span style=\"color: red;\">chief queen then has to mimic copulation\nwith the dead horse</span>, while the other queens ritually utter obscenities (\nprobably they were singing&nbsp; ribald songs\nlike DARA SINGH KA&nbsp; LUND--&nbsp; TEE HEEEE ! ).<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">On the next morning,\n<span style=\"color: red;\">the priests raise the queen from the place where she has spent the night with\nthe horse. </span><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The three queens with a\nhundred golden, silver and copper needles indicate the lines on the horse's\nbody along which it will be dissected. The horse is dissected, and its <span style=\"color: red;\">flesh\nroasted</span>. Various parts are offered to a host of deities and personified\nconcepts with<span style=\"color: red;\"> utterances of svaha</span> \"all-hail\".<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The human sacrifice,\nthe Purushamedha, followed a similar format,&nbsp;\nbut included a <span style=\"color: red;\">man with the animals to be sacrificed.</span> The price of the\nman was set at one thousand cows and a hundred horses. Like the horse, the man\nchosen for sacrifice was allowed to wander for a year. Once he had been killed,\nthe <span style=\"color: red;\">queen lay with his corpse.</span><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Laws of Manu refer\nto the Ashvamedha (V.53): 'The man who offers a horse-sacrifice every day for a\nhundred years, and the man who does not eat meat, the two of them reap the same\nfruit of good deeds.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In the Mahabharata, the\nsacrifice is performed by Yudhishtira (. <span style=\"color: red;\">After the horse was cut into parts,\nDraupadi had to sit beside the parts of the horse</span>.)<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The ritual was\nperformed in <span style=\"color: red;\">strict compliance with Vedic prescriptions (1.14.10).</span> Dasaratha's\nchief wife Kausalya circumambulates the horse and ritually pierces its flesh\n(1.14.33). <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Then \"<span style=\"color: red;\">Queen\nKausalya</span> desiring the results of ritual disconcertedly<span style=\"color: red;\"> resided one night with\nthat horse</span> that flew away like a bird.\" .<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">At the conclusion of\nthe ritual <span style=\"color: red;\">Dasharatha symbolically offers his other wives to the presiding\npriests</span>, who return them in exchange for expensive gifts.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;\"An empire is like a horse and the subjects\nlike other inferior animals\" (p. 448). Thus, VSM 23.22, literally \"he<span style=\"color: red;\">\nbeats on the vulva (gabha), the penis (pasas) oozes repeatedly (ni-galgaliti)\nin the receptacle</span>\"<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u201c <span style=\"color: red;\">The three authors of\nthe Vedas were buffoons, knaves, and demons</span>. All the well-known formulae of the\npandits, jarphari, turphari, etc. and all the <span style=\"color: red;\">obscene rites for the queen\ncommanded in Aswamedha</span>, these were invented by buffoons, and so all the various\nkinds of presents to the priests, while the <span style=\"color: red;\">eating of flesh was similarly\ncommanded by night-prowling demons.\u201d</span><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: red;\">The mock bestiality (\nsexual intercourse with animals ) and necrophilia ( sexual attraction to dead\nanimals ) involved in the ritual caused considerable consternation among the\nscholar</span>s first editing the Yajurveda. Griffith (1899) omits verses VSM 23.20\u201331\n(the ritual obscenities), protesting that they are \"<span style=\"background-color: yellow;\"><span style=\"color: red;\">not reproducible even\nin the semi-obscurity of a learned European language</span>\" (alluding to other\ninstances where he renders explicit scenes in Latin rather than English). A. B.\nKeith's 1914 translation also omits verses.</span><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">This part of the ritual\noffended the Dalit reformer and framer of the Indian constitution B. R.\nAmbedkar and is frequently mentioned in his writings as an example of the\nperceived degradation of Brahmanical culture.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">UNQUOTE: <o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The great Maharishi Kapila\n&nbsp;burnt all the uncles of King Suman (\ngrandfather of King Bhaghirata) into ashes by his angry gaze when they tried to\nblame him for stopping the white Ashwamedha horse. &nbsp;&nbsp;The\nhorse had run too fast for the followers to keep pace and was just hanging\naround near the meditating Maharishi inside his ashram.&nbsp;&nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">So what is the truth\nabout ASHWAMEDHA YAGNA?<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The truth is the horse\nis NOT killed at all-- leave alone the queen having sexual intercourse with a\ndead horse's you know what.. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">A spirited horse is\nchosen , with white fur and no blemishes. A yagna ( Agnihotra homam ) is held\nBEFORE the horse sets out on a guided tour.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Ashwamedha yagna cannot\nbe held by a mortal.&nbsp; It is held by the\nking of Gods Indra.&nbsp; It can only be done\nby a mortal king if he is commanded to do it by an avatar of Vishnu.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">This tradition was\nbroken by King Mahabali of Kerala. He was an asura ( demon ) king. The people\nof Kerala were very happy with this king as he was a wise and just ruler, and\nthere was prosperity all over.&nbsp; King\nMahabali did the Ashwameda yagna.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">This made Indra very\njealous, as this was his prerogative, and nobody had the guts to kill the white\nAshwamedha horse&nbsp; of King Mahabali.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">He prevailed on Aditi,\nhis mother to convince Vishnu to correct this imbalance, where an Asura King\ncould cock a snook at the King of Gods . Vishnu decided to intervene and took\nthe 5th&nbsp; avatar of Vamana --a blue faced\nBrahmin midget ( dwarf ) .</span><span style=\"font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://1.bp.blogspot.com/-NuizVGQ_thA/U8Yeh2O4Q7I/AAAAAAAAtrc/rzN_Pj8Qk5A/s1600/imagesCAYPUCuuFU.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" src=\"http://1.bp.blogspot.com/-NuizVGQ_thA/U8Yeh2O4Q7I/AAAAAAAAtrc/rzN_Pj8Qk5A/s1600/imagesCAYPUCuuFU.jpg\" height=\"400\" width=\"299\" /></a></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Brahmin dwarf asked\nKing Mahabali for alms-- a small grant of land. &nbsp;The King told him that he can take as much\nland area as he wished, within his kingdom . But the midget wanted only three\nstrides ( paces )&nbsp; of land.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Immediately the kings\nadvisor Sage Shukracharya who was a seer, advised his king NOT to agree to this\nrequest, as he suspected something amiss and was sure of foul play.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Mahabali being a very\ngenerous king, could NOT imagine going back on his word, during a divine\nsacrifice.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">So he agreed to grant\nthe boon of three paces of land. Vamana immediately assumed the gigantic form\nof Vishnu ( the Preserver lord ) and in the first two steps covered the whole\nof earth and cosmos.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Then he asked the king\nwhere he should keep his third step. The king bowed down on his knees and told\nhim to place the third step on his head.</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Before that he asked\nthat he should be able to visit and bless his subjects once every year .<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Vishnu granted this\nboon and placed his foot on Mahabali's head and instead of driving him\nunderground to the netherworld , he sent him to heaven -- pleased with his\nrighteousness.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">THIS IS THE REASON WHY\nALL MALAYALIS CELEBRATE ONAM -- THE DAY THE KING WILL COME EVERY YEAR.&nbsp;&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">A CARPET OF FRESH\nFLOWERS IS LAID AT THE ENTRANCE OF EVERY HOUSE.&nbsp;\nDIWALI OR DEEPAWALI MARKS THE VICTORY OF GODS , OR DEFEAT OF KING\nMAHABALI .&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">DIWALI IS CELEBRATED BY\nTHE WHOLE OF INDIA -- EXCEPT KERALA.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">So why is the white\nhorse on a guided tour?&nbsp; This is the\nessence of Ashwameda.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The emperor seeks to\ncheck out if any of his vassal kings want to challenge his supreme authority\u2014\nin public.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The horse is guided by\nthe Emperor\u2019s generals and chosen ministers . They generals follow the white\nhorse on their own horses. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The horse with clanging\nbells is made to travel through the vassal kingdoms.&nbsp; Any vassal king can kill the horse and thus\ndeclare war on the Emperor,&nbsp; which will\nhappen pretty soon.&nbsp; If he just captures\nthe horse, there may be room for negotiation.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The horse is even taken\nto enemy kingdoms, and there is \u201cdiplomatic immunity\u201d for the Emperor\u2019s men not\nthe white horse.&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Any tough acting\nintentions are gauged out. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">When the horse returns\nsafe and sound, it means all is well-- and the emperor's supreme authority is\nunchallenged.&nbsp; And all know it too.</span><span style=\"font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://2.bp.blogspot.com/-1bFUFaqc_i0/U8YetPDnxWI/AAAAAAAAtrk/CjaSG1KlCrU/s1600/downloadhHKJJUTC.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" src=\"http://2.bp.blogspot.com/-1bFUFaqc_i0/U8YetPDnxWI/AAAAAAAAtrk/CjaSG1KlCrU/s1600/downloadhHKJJUTC.jpg\" height=\"281\" width=\"400\" /></a></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In the POST Ashwamedha\nyagna all vassal kings are invited, and there are celebrations all around\n,&nbsp; for peace and prosperity&nbsp; in future.&nbsp;\nSoldiers go home to their families.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">IN MODERN TERMS THIS IS\nLIKE A OPEN \"CONFIDENCE \" MOTION IN THE PARLIAMENT.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Getting back to the\nAryan theory-<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">About this time in\nhistory the similarities between Indo-European languages also became evident. &nbsp;Sanskrit and the languages of North India were\nfound to be relatives of the languages of Europe (sic!) , while the Dravidian\nlanguages of south India were established by the white man &nbsp;to belong to another language family.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">This is nonsense as Malayalam ( my language )\nis closest to Sanskrit. &nbsp;At school it was\neasy for us to MAX in Sanskrit language. &nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Shukracharya was the political advisor to King\nMahabali , thousands of years before Lord Parashurama came to Kerala with his\nband of Namboodiris. Our King Mahabali did NOT do GRUNT GRUNT with Maharishi Shukracharya,\nwho is god of the Parsis..<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">It was German Jew Rothschild\nand his historians who injected the idea adopted by Hitler along with the\nSwastika symbol .&nbsp; That Aryans are a superior\nrace.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">What is the SWASTIKA\nsymbol?<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue; font-size: x-large;\"><b>By the way there was NO\nSati till the Islamic invader came to India.&nbsp;</b></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">Once a Hindu king is defeated, the\nmuslim invaders used to allow sex slaves as bounty. &nbsp;</span></i></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; The Rajasthanis &nbsp;used to call it jauhar.<o:p></o:p></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\"><br /></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">The first instance of\nsati was done by the wife of a Sindhi King Raja Dahir.<o:p></o:p></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\"><br /></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">The Muslim invaders Raja\nDahir the last Hindu ruler of Sindh who ruled for 32 long years , a bad\nname.&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></i></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\"><br /></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">They charged this\nPushkarna Brahmin king with marrying his own sister. No Hindu will EVER marry\nhis own sister \u2013this is just a big muslim lie..<o:p></o:p></span></i></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\"><br /></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://1.bp.blogspot.com/-h0gZxF9R15U/U8Y5XPP8GHI/AAAAAAAAttI/JE74Xc3Lyvc/s1600/scene-from-a-muslimycd-slave-market-of-white-women2-otto-pilny.png\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" src=\"http://1.bp.blogspot.com/-h0gZxF9R15U/U8Y5XPP8GHI/AAAAAAAAttI/JE74Xc3Lyvc/s1600/scene-from-a-muslimycd-slave-market-of-white-women2-otto-pilny.png\" height=\"420\" width=\"640\" /></a></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://1.bp.blogspot.com/-6g-C68bvFiA/U8Y5ZgxUlNI/AAAAAAAAttQ/4tW_k_QszsU/s1600/iman+cges.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" src=\"http://1.bp.blogspot.com/-6g-C68bvFiA/U8Y5ZgxUlNI/AAAAAAAAttQ/4tW_k_QszsU/s1600/iman+cges.jpg\" height=\"400\" width=\"229\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\"><br /></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">Raja Dahir had offered\nrefuge to Mohammad the Prophet\u2019s&nbsp;\ngrandson Hussain. When Hussian was on his way to Sindh he was ambushed\nat Karbala Iraq , tortured and killed .<o:p></o:p></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; In this divine geometry which holds\nthe THEORY OF EVERYTHING , &nbsp;3 lines\nintersect at 54 points ( number of sanskrit alphabets ) with Shiva and Shakti\nqualities making the magic Hindu number 108..the numerical equivalent of OM. &nbsp;&nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">54 devas and asuras had\nchurned for the amrit or holy nectar. All mantras are repeated 108 times. All\nprayer beads count up to 108. There are 108 upanishads. Nataraja's cosmic dance\nhas 108 Bharatanatyam poses. 12 rashis and 9 navagrahas multiply to 108. Sun's\ndiameter is 108 times that of the earth.&nbsp;\nThe distance between the Earth and Sun is 108 times the diameter of the\nSun .&nbsp; Ayurveda and Kalari talks about\n108 marmas.&nbsp; Shiva, Ganesha and Krishna\nhas 108 names.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The 108 th and heaviest element in the periodic table is Hassium\n( 108 protons ) . The rest are too short lived. Sri Yantra is the foundation of\nVaastu ( the original feng shui ). Vaastu insisted on the PERFECT , NESW\ncardinal orientation--just like the pyramids.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">If you stare at the\ncentre spot ( bindu singularity ) every morning for 5 minutes , you will\nbalance your left and right brain lobes.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; line-height: 150%; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://3.bp.blogspot.com/-As83yfeW0Os/U8dIN_QMWwI/AAAAAAAAtuI/RVChYyZM_jQ/s1600/rrt.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; line-height: 150%;\">Look into the center of\nthe Yantra, trying to blink as rarely as possible; you don't want to look at\nthe particular details of the Yantra, just keep your sight right in the center\nand observe the whole Yantra at once.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\"In time, after at\nleast seven days of Yantra meditation you will be able to tap into the same\nyantric energy even without a Yantra (at the beginning you may fix your sight\non an exterior or imaginary point or evoke the Yantra with your eyes closed).<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\"In superior\nphases the Yantra absorbs the practitioner's complete attention, and he can no\nlonger tell if the Yantra is within himself or if he is within the Yantra; this\nis the state of non-duality.\"<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; line-height: 150%; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://2.bp.blogspot.com/-d7vHTDDY_fg/U8dO3IXVuoI/AAAAAAAAtvg/M1fofL3PGhQ/s1600/27hh280_e.png\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; line-height: 150%;\">The goal of\ncontemplating the Sri Yantra is that the adept can rediscover his primordial\nsources. The circuits symbolically indicate the successive phases in the\nprocess of becoming.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Circle = Energy of the\nelement water<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue; font-size: large;\"><b>ISAAC NEWTON , THE\nCALCULUS THIEF &nbsp;VADAKAYIL&nbsp; .</b></span><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">As per tantra ( no perverted\nsex here pleaaje ) , the creation of the world begins with an act of division\nof the opposites that are united in the deity. &nbsp;From their splitting arises, in an explosion\nof energy, the multiplicity of the world. &nbsp;Starting from pure unity (Shiva), the world is\na continuous unfolding (energized by the power of Shakti), until a state is\nreached, when the process must reverse and involute back to the very beginning.\n&nbsp;Multiplicity must once again become\nunity. &nbsp;Yantras are mystical diagramic or symbolic\nrepresentations of this process of evolution and involution.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; line-height: 150%; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://4.bp.blogspot.com/-rElNzhk4C6g/U8dNeSgMrQI/AAAAAAAAtvA/UDs8v36Jfhg/s1600/bnyym.png\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">As per tantra ( no\nperverted sex here pleaaje ) , the creation of the world begins with an act of\ndivision of the opposites that are united in the deity.&nbsp; From their splitting arises, in an explosion\nof energy, the multiplicity of the world.&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Starting from pure unity (Shiva), the world is a continuous unfolding\n(energized by the power of Shakti), until a state is reached, when the process\nmust reverse and involute back to the very beginning.&nbsp; Multiplicity must once again become\nunity.&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Yantras are mystical diagramic or\nsymbolic representations of this process of evolution and involution, put down\non paper by ancient seers. According to Tantra, the human being is a miniature\nuniverse. All that is found in the cosmos can be found within each individual,\nand the same principles that apply to the universe apply in the case of the\nindividual being.</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">For human beings the body is considered the most perfect and\npowerful of all yantras and is seen as a tool for inner awareness.&nbsp; &nbsp;A 12\nstrand DNA maharishi had immense powers. &nbsp;An EARTHY AVATAR like Ram or Krishna there\nwere extra strand of DNA which gave them superhuman powers..like converting\nenergy to matter &nbsp;. &nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">A yantra is thus a potent tool making the\nprocess of evolution conscious to the adept of Tantrism. &nbsp;&nbsp;It enables the adept to retrace his steps\nfrom the outward-directed world of multiplicity to the inward focus of unity. &nbsp;All primal shapes of a yantra are\npsychological symbols corresponding to inner states of human consciousness.\nYantras are sacred symbols of the process of involution and evolution.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; line-height: 150%; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://2.bp.blogspot.com/-OKKxX_yd1jc/U8dOP4BdT8I/AAAAAAAAtvI/vA8XeReeeOU/s1600/5-Naturrrres-8.1.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" src=\"http://2.bp.blogspot.com/-OKKxX_yd1jc/U8dOP4BdT8I/AAAAAAAAtvI/vA8XeReeeOU/s1600/5-Naturrrres-8.1.jpg\" height=\"472\" width=\"640\" /></a></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Tantra, says that the\nentire universe is a manifestation of pure consciousness . In manifesting the\nuniverse, this pure consciousness seems to become divided into two poles or\naspects, neither of which can exist without the other. &nbsp;Each requires the other in order to manifest\nits total nature. &nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><o:p></o:p></span><span style=\"font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Shiva ( Purusha ) has\nthe power to be but not the power to become or change. </span><span style=\"font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Shakti ( pragati-Aditi ) is the Great Mother\nof the universe, for it is from her that all form is born.</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Tantra says that the\nhuman being is a miniature universe. &nbsp;All\nthat is found in the cosmos can be found within each individual, and the same\nprinciples that apply to the universe apply in the case of the individual\nbeing.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; line-height: 150%; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://1.bp.blogspot.com/-0r_DM2_jCsY/U8dRKoWHgBI/AAAAAAAAtv8/BKIARTtTh9A/s1600/vbuum.png\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" src=\"http://1.bp.blogspot.com/-0r_DM2_jCsY/U8dRKoWHgBI/AAAAAAAAtv8/BKIARTtTh9A/s1600/vbuum.png\" height=\"412\" width=\"640\" /></a></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Tantra says that the\nstate of ultimate bliss is a transcendence of dualities male-female,\nenergy-consciousness, Shiva-Shakti...<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Tantra says that\nchakras arepsychic centers that lie along the axis of the spine as\nconsciousness potentials. &nbsp;They are\nusually represented as lotuses ( vortex ) . &nbsp;The chakras are not in the gross body, but in\nthe subtle or etheric body.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; line-height: 150%; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://1.bp.blogspot.com/-NIuqOfA0-hg/U8dShwp9wGI/AAAAAAAAtwI/XXbLCaVi5lA/s1600/imggrages.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" src=\"http://1.bp.blogspot.com/-NIuqOfA0-hg/U8dShwp9wGI/AAAAAAAAtwI/XXbLCaVi5lA/s1600/imggrages.jpg\" height=\"320\" width=\"320\" /></a></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">As kundalini reaches\neach chakra, that lotus opens and lift its flower---symbolising the energies of the chakra and their assimilation to\nkundalini.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Tantra ( no perverted\nsex here pleeaaje ) says that each of the chakras, &nbsp;corresponds to one of the elements of which\nthe known world is compounded. &nbsp;Muladhara\nrepresents solidity; &nbsp;Svadhisthana,\nliquidity; &nbsp;Manipura, the gaseous; &nbsp;Anahata, the aerial; &nbsp;Vishuddha, the etheric, or space. &nbsp;It is obvious even to a dim-wit that the whole\nprocess is a progressive transformation of the elements, with an increase of\nvolatility.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">According to the tantra\nmanual, &nbsp;Shiva Samhita, there are\nfourteen principal nadis. &nbsp;Of these, Ida,\nPingala and Sushumna are the most important. In Muladhara, Shakti, the static\nunmanifested Kundalini, is symbolized by a serpent coiled into three and a half\ncircles around the central axis Svayambhu-linga at the base of the spine. The\nserpent lies blocking the entrance to Sushumna, the central channel with his\nmouth. Sushumna remains closed at its lower end as long as Kundalini is not\nawakened. The technique of Kundalini Yoga consists in using Prana (the vital\nair), guiding its circulatory movement through Ida and Pingala down to the base\nof the spine into the space where Kundalini lies coiled.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The vital energies of\nthe opposite forces circulating in Ida and Pingala will be unified and Shakti\nKundalini will then awaken and rise up Sushumna, energizing the seven chakras .\nIn Ajna chakra the meeting of the three main nadis is called Mukta Triveni\n(Mukta: \"liberated\"). Continuing beyond Ajna chakra, Ida and Pingala\nend in the left and right nostrils respectively.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\"In the\nbeginning,darkness was hidden by darkness, all this was one ocean of\ninconscience. Universal being was concealed by fragmentation.\" <b>Rig Veda (X.129.1-5) &nbsp;- written down in 5000 BC, passed on by audio sruti\nsince 28000 BC<o:p></o:p></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><b><br /></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\"Agni has entered\nearth and heaven as if they were one,\"<b>&nbsp; Rig Veda (III.7.4).<o:p></o:p></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><b><br /></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Without involution\nno evolution would be possible, for how could something come out of nothing. &nbsp;We\nneed a place to BANG the BIG BANG , right? &nbsp; Even a retarded child can figure\nthis out. &nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span><span style=\"font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">In Hinduism the concept\nis INHALATION/ EXHALATION like in the Klein bottle</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; line-height: 150%; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://1.bp.blogspot.com/-i-RxsFecGXw/U8dZupM8_vI/AAAAAAAAtwY/H1ar1-F88HM/s1600/cffover.gif\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" src=\"http://1.bp.blogspot.com/-i-RxsFecGXw/U8dZupM8_vI/AAAAAAAAtwY/H1ar1-F88HM/s1600/cffover.gif\" height=\"400\" width=\"262\" /></a></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The microcosm of the\nhuman body has a cosmic relationship to the macrocosm of the universe, and this\nis what Hindu astrology is all about. &nbsp;&nbsp;My wife consulted more than 300 horoscopes\nbefore she settled for a suitable girl for my elder son. font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">2-Mah\u00e9swari is\nrepresentative of anger.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">3-Kaumari of constant\navarice and greed.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">4-Vaishanavi fascinates\nand infatuates.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">5-Varahi is symbolic of\nobstinancy and false pride.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">6-Indrani is symbolic\nof jealousy.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">7-Chamunda earthly\nrewards.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<span style=\"font-family: Times New Roman, serif; font-size: small;\"><span style=\"line-height: 150%;\">8-Mahalakshmi\nsymbolises our deficiencies and&nbsp;</span></span><span style=\"font-family: Times New Roman, serif;\"><span style=\"line-height: 24px;\">blameworthiness</span></span><span style=\"font-family: Times New Roman, serif; font-size: small;\"><span style=\"line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;generally.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; line-height: 150%; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://2.bp.blogspot.com/-vPH_jQ0QWDA/U8ddx4Vf6YI/AAAAAAAAtws/gkHdjEdY9R4/s1600/3.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" src=\"http://2.bp.blogspot.com/-vPH_jQ0QWDA/U8ddx4Vf6YI/AAAAAAAAtws/gkHdjEdY9R4/s1600/3.jpg\" height=\"348\" width=\"640\" /></a></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">1- Speech<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">2- Grasping<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">3- Locomotion<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">4- Evacuation<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">5- Enjoyment<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">6- Attitude of\nrejection<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">7- Attitude of\nacceptance<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">8- Attitude of\nindifference.&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Punch into Google\nsearch-<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue; font-size: large;\"><b>SECRETS OF MUDRAS &nbsp;VADAKAYIL</b></span><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;;
